A free day in Hoi An - There are no activities or excursions arranged for today. Enjoy your free day wandering around to explore Hoi An’s hidden charm or consider visiting My Son Sanctuary – the most important Cham site in Vietnam. This evening, you will head to Danang for the night train to Nha Trang. Overnight Train (B)

Island Getaway - On arrival in Nha Trang, it is about a two-hour transfer to Whale island, an isolated island in the Ninh Van bay. Whale Island is one of the most beautiful islands in Vietnam with untouched and peaceful scenery. It has an area of about 40ha and is uninhabited. There is only the one resort with 31 rooms on the island and staying here has been compared to being castaway on a desert island. We will have time to relax, to sun-bath or you may want to explore the small trek paths. For the more active, a range of water activities are offered by the resort. Overnight at the Whale Island Resort (BLD)
Overnight Train to Saigon - Enjoy a lay-back day on the island. In the late afternoon, we will depart and take an overnight train to Saigon. Overnight Train (B)

Cu Chi Tunnel by boat - On arrival in Saigon, we head out to explore the most recent history of Vietnam through-out the most important sites of the city. Start your tour at the Central Post Office, a beautiful and unique colonial building with a dome built by Gustave Eiffel before he built his famous tower in Paris. Observe Notre Dame (under renovation) before heading to the Reunification Palace. From there, you will stop by the War Remnants Museum to learn about the war which is known by Vietnamese as the American War. Enjoy a local lunch then head to Cu Chi Tunnels right outside of the city, a unique underground city built during the American War. Overnight at the Dyn Opera Hotel or similar (BL)

Life on the Mekong Delta - Head out of Saigon this morning to explore the mighty Mekong delta. A journey of three hours will drive you to the heart of the peaceful countryside. Discover daily life as it goes on right in front of you as we explore on a river-cruise. We stop by the different sites and get to observe in detail the different artisanal workshops. Enjoy a local lunch prepared by an experienced cook before hopping on a sampan to explore the small canals and to feel the peace of the countryside. This evening we have a farewell dinner. Overnight at the Dyn Opera Hotel or similar (BLD)
Depart Saigon - No activities are planned for today. Check out at your leisure and you will then be transferred to the airport to catch your return flight.

tourName: Vietnam classic tour, North to South
generalInfo:
Discover the timeless beauty of Vietnam on this 8-day classic journey, taking you from the elegant streets of Hanoi to the natural wonder of Halong Bay, and ending in the lively buzz of Ho Chi Minh City. Blending rich history, breathtaking scenery, and authentic cultural experiences, this itinerary offers the perfect balance of exploration and comfort.

Ideal for first-time visitors and cultural explorers, the tour features UNESCO World Heritage Sites, street food adventures, overnight cruising, and local-led city tours. From wandering lantern-lit lanes in Hanoi’s Old Quarter to gliding past limestone karsts in Halong Bay, every moment deepens your connection to Vietnam’s heritage and everyday life.

Your journey begins in Hanoi, Vietnam’s historic capital. Walk through the bustling Old Quarter, visit landmarks like the Temple of Literature and One Pillar Pagoda, and witness the traditional art of the water puppet show. Savor local flavors on a guided street food tour, or take part in an optional cooking class with a local chef.

Next, sail through the breathtaking beauty of Halong Bay on a traditional wooden junk boat. Spend the night aboard, enjoying kayaking, cave excursions, and a sunset cooking demo on deck. Wake to sunrise over the water and indulge in freshly prepared seafood meals while surrounded by emerald waters and soaring cliffs.

The adventure concludes in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam’s southern hub of energy and history. Explore colonial-era architecture, including the Notre-Dame Cathedral and Central Post Office, and gain insight at the War Remnants Museum. Dive into market life at Ben Thanh and enjoy vibrant evenings in rooftop lounges or street food alleys.

A day trip to the Cu Chi Tunnels reveals a powerful chapter of Vietnam’s past, while an optional extension to the Mekong Delta offers a peaceful cruise through palm-shaded canals and visits to traditional villages.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Hanoi & Transfer to hotel
Hanoi City Excursion
Hanoi - Halong Bay, Overnight at Cruise
Halong Bay - Hanoi excursion
Fly to Ho Chi Minh and Free Day
City Tour & Cu Chi Tunnels Tour
Full Day Excursion to Mekong Delta
Ho Chi Minh Departure

generalInfo:
Vietnam’s unique geography often leads travelers along a well-worn path, but this holiday takes a different route. Perfect for those wanting to step away from the everyday and get a different perspective on Vietnam.

Highlights include:

Staying in safari-style tents overlooking Lak Lake in Vietnam's central highlands.
Kayak, cycle, and trek through the spectacular Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park, home to the world’s largest caves.

Ride pillion on a vintage Vespa along the iconic Hoi An to Hue coastline.
Journey north through the countryside on the Reunification Express from Dong Hoi to Hanoi.

Explore the lesser-known districts of Saigon and Hanoi with insider tours of backstreets and traditional markets.

This is a bespoke holiday suggestion and we can change this holiday to suit your budget, style and expectations

dayInfo.description: Depart the UK: Set off from the UK on an overnight flight bound for Ho Chi Minh City, also known as Saigon.

Vespa Coastal Adventure from Hoi An to Hue: Today, you’ll travel from Hoi An to Hue, a route that showcases some of Vietnam’s most breathtaking views. Choose between a train journey or an exhilarating ride on a vintage Vespa. If you take the Vespa, you’ll have an experienced driver leading the way as you drive over the famed Hai Van Pass. Upon arriving in Hue, settle into your hotel for a two-night stay and spend a day exploring with your guide, uncovering the city’s remarkable historical sites.

Phong Nga Ke Bang Caves: The journey from Hue to your accommodation at Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park. This remarkable park boasts one of the world’s largest limestone regions, housing some of the planet’s most expansive caves. Spend your first night in a lodge on the park’s edge, relaxing and savouring the scenery and local activities. During your stay, choose from a range of adventurous activities, from kayaking and bike tours to nature trails. Additionally, consider an in-depth caving adventure with or without an overnight camping experience in the jungle or cave. This promises an unforgettable way to experience the national park, complete with cave swimming, jungle treks, and night-time barbecues.

Reunification Express to Hanoi: Transfer to Dong Hoi, where you’ll board the “Reunification Express” train. Opt for a day train and relish the scenic journey through Northern Vietnam, or opt for a night train with a comfortable sleeper cabin bound for Hanoi.

Hanoi: Arrive in Hanoi and check in to your hotel. Over the next couple of days, delve into a series of tailored experiences led by your private guide. Begin your mornings early with a visit to the vibrant flower markets and a stroll around the city’s lakes, where Hanoians practice t’ai chi. Immerse yourself in the bustling old town, where residents go about their daily routines seemingly unfazed by the slow-moving trains. Savour Vietnamese coffee, explore the dynamic street food scene and try a refreshing local beer at a roadside stall. Marvel at the elegant French colonial architecture and navigate the labyrinthine alleyways of the old quarter. Dive into your chosen museums, be it ancient history, military history, fine arts, or the tranquil Temple of Literature.
Departure: Today marks your departure from Vietnam as you embark on your flight back to the UK.

generalInfo: Vietnam has many natural wonders that will amaze even a picky traveler. For those who want to immerse in the serenity of beautiful nature and get closer to the local community, we have designed a Vietnam Green Escape tour. This tour will show you the hidden areas of Hanoi, and take you off-the-beaten paths to explore the mountains, rice terraces, and ethnic villages in Pu Luong. You will see the spectacular landscapes of UNESCO World Heritage sites Ninh Binh and Halong Bay before heading to Hoi An, a small ancient town with rich cultural heritage. Take a walking tour to explore the historical sites of Hoi An and visit the hidden village, where locals will share with you the secrets of making beautiful art from driftwood. On top of that, during the trip, you will stay in sustainable accommodations, enriching your experience with a more local touch and an opportunity to get closer to nature.

dayInfo.description: HANOI ARRIVAL Upon arrival at Noi Bai Airport, after clearing all customs procedures, please proceed to the exit gate and meet our driver, who will be waiting in the lobby, holding the signboard with your name on it. If you cannot locate your driver, please go to the Airport information counter in the middle of the Domestic and International arrival lobby (inside the terminal) and call the emergency numbers provided in the confirmation voucher for assistance. Your driver will come to meet you up and transfer you to your hotel in the Old Quarter. Overnight in Hanoi

HA NOI LIFE ALONG THE RAILWAY (B/L) After breakfast at the hotel, you will meet with the local coordinator, who will give you a briefing on the tour program and introduce the volunteering activities, in which you will participate. After the meeting, you will have the opportunity to explore the hidden side of Hanoi, where local people do their day-to-day business living and working alongside the railway. Your guide will introduce you to the people who share their space with Hanoi's main rail artery. You will also explore the bustling markets which play an important role in this community. At 9:30 am, your guide will meet you at the hotel lobby and take you to the food market on Kham Thien Street, where you will see how people shop for some local key ingredients found in Vietnamese cuisine. After a short exploration of the market, turn off the main road and walk down narrow side streets before arriving at Alley Le Duan with a great view of one of the city's 'railway streets'. Here you will witness people enjoying a coffee on the tracks, chatting with friends, or hanging out their washing before casually making way for the oncoming trains. If the train schedule permits, you might witness the train passing by this narrow street. Afterward, move towards Hanoi station with the strange mix of colonial and socialist architecture. Continue walking through some local areas and enjoy a stop at Cua Dong Street for a morning refreshment before the car picks you up and takes you to Gia Lam Station. At this station, hop on the train and travel to Long Bien Station. On arrival, you will have the chance to visit a bustling market located in the shadow of the famed Long Bien Bridge - a French relic that played a crucial role in the Vietnam War due to its strategic position. The bridge was heavily bombed, but some original sections remain. Overnight in Hanoi Notes Suggested departure time: 09:30 Tour duration: 3.5 hours

HANOI – PU LUONG – EXPLORE VILLAGE LIFE AND THE COMMUNITY (B) Get up early in the morning to have breakfast and get ready for your next adventure. Today we will take you on to 4-hour drive to Pu Luong Nature Reserve. This place is a perfect eco-tourism site with beautiful mountains, green rainforests, and authentic villages. Upon arrival at Pu Luong Retreat, check in the room and relax in the beautiful garden overviewing the mountain landscapes. In the afternoon, take a walk to get closer to the village and see the daily routine of the locals that live in the hills above the retreat. See how farmers are working in the rice fields, and admire the stilt houses of local minorities. Your guide will help you to accommodate a small chat with the people you meet to understand better the local traditions and way of living. Overnight in Pu Luong Retreat

PU LUONG RETREAT - WALKING AND CYCLING IN THE VILLAGES (B/L) Enjoy breakfast at the hotel and take an easy walk around the beautiful valley with rice terraces. Then continue to walk through small paths shrouded in vegetation to slowly reveal a picturesque Uoi village sitting at the base of a towering mountain. Your camera will not be able to sit still when you see the panoramic views of the village from above. Continue walking downhill to a local home, where you can rest before cycling around Lan Village. If time permits, we could visit a local family, which makes traditional brocade weaving (not guaranteed). Then cycle along the rice paddies to another village, where you will explore more beautiful landscapes. Then ride back to the local home, where the car will pick us up and transfer back to your hotel for lunch. In the afternoon, relax and enjoy the peaceful surroundings of the retreat. This beautiful and peaceful area is a perfect place to unwind and connect with nature. Overnight in Pu Luong Retreat

PU LUONG – TRANSFER TO NINH BINH – VISIT TRANG AN, TAM COC & MUA CAVE (B/L) Have breakfast at the hotel and depart for a 3-hour drive to the Trang An Landscape Complex in Ninh Binh Province. Recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2014, Trang An is famed for its spectacular landscape of limestone karst peaks whose sheer vertical walls rise abruptly 200m (656ft) above the surrounding land and water. The dense rainforest of the landscape that is clinging to the cliffs and peaks, blends naturally with rice paddy fields and rivers, creating a picturesque patchwork of color. In the afternoon, visit Tam Coc, known as “Halong Bay on Land”, where a skilled rower will take you on a 2-hour slow journey on the winding river and canals. Enjoy the views of the beautiful karst formations as you enter into natural caves formed under the hills. After the boat trip, climb to Mua Mountain, which has a shape of a bell with a base sized around 800 square meters. On the left and right sides of the staircase, there are beautiful carvings of the dragon or phoenix. The way leading to the cave formed by a long stone staircase zigzags through the karst, there are nearly 500 steps to a simple altar to Quan Am (the Goddess of Mercy). Later you will be transferred to your hotel in Ninh Binh. Overnight in Ninh Binh Notes Suggested departure time: 08:00 Tour duration: 8.5 hours

NINH BINH – HA LONG BAY (B/L/D) – shared cruise Today you will explore Halong Bay, the UNESCO World Heritage site that is known for its stunning limestone karsts and emerald waters. Enjoy the delicious breakfast at the hotel and meet your driver. Take the most scenic route to reach Halong Bay, taking you across the Red River Delta with emerald green rice paddies stretching for as far as the eyes can see. On arrival at the pier, you will board the cruise and enjoy the fantastic views of limestone rocks and the karst grottoes. Have an utterly delicious seafood lunch and enjoy the time at the sundeck exploring the Bay. The cruise will stop in a secret place where you will spend time kayaking or swimming, so you can explore the karst grottoes closer. Towards the evening, you will return to the boat for an early dinner, followed by some time at leisure. You can optionally attend the activities taking part on the boat or just relax. Overnight on cruise Note: In case of bad weather (the boat is not allowed to push off or not allowed to overnight in the sea), the Ha Long Bay tour could be canceled without notice. We will consider other replacement tours or a refund based on the specific circumstances.

HA LONG BAY – HA NOI (B) Rise early today to view the sunrise at the wonder of nature with breakfast served in the dining room. A Tai Chi class on the sun deck will awaken your mind and muscles. Then head off to visit the limestone cave full of stalagmites and stalactites. After your exploration return to the boat to check out and enjoy the brunch while the cruise is sailing back to the harbor. Later you will be transferred to your accommodation in Hanoi. Overnight in Hanoi

HA NOI FLY TO HOI AN – HOI AN ECOLODGE (B) Relish the remaining moment in Hanoi before your private driver escorts you to the airport to take the flight to Da Nang. When you arrive at Da Nang Airport, your driver will pick you up and transfer you to your accommodation in Hoi An. The rest of the time is free for leisure. Hoi An is known for its beautiful old town and colorful lanterns, which will look especially charming after dark, so we recommend you to have a walk around the old town in the evening. Overnight in Hoi An

HOI AN WALKING TOUR AND BOAT TRIP ALONG THU BON RIVER (B) a pleasant walk around the charming town of Hoi An. This World Heritage ancient town is known for its well-preserved architecture, pedestrian-only streets, and distinctive local cuisine that give visitors a glimpse of its illustrious past. Hoi An’s narrow lanes are ideal for a guided walking tour of its many atmospheric sights including the old merchant houses with a mixture of Chinese, Japanese, and Vietnamese architecture; the 400-year-old Japanese Covered Bridge, first built in the 1590s by the Japanese community to link them with the Chinese quarters across the stream; the Assembly Hall of the Chaozhou Chinese Congregation with its intricate woodcarvings; and the colorful market with stalls brimming with local specialties, silk, and clothes. Then end your tour with an hour-long boat trip on the Thu Bon River, which will give you a closer view of fishing boats and country villages before heading to your hotel. Overnight in Hoi An

HOI AN - DRIFTWOOD VILLAGE (B) Today you will spend time in the beautiful village surrounded by rice paddies and learn about fascinating carpentry art. Take a morning drive to visit the Driftwood Village. It is a community of local artisans who create beautiful art from driftwood collected from the nearby beaches. Learn about the local carpentry traditions and listen to the story of the village while admiring the vast collection of works in the art studio. Many local artisans use sustainable materials and practices, which makes these crafts even more special. Listen to inspiring stories of the artisans about how they put meaning and messages in each intricate detail of their art and learn the basic technics to use the chisel. Then try your hands at making your own craft under the guidance of our skillful artisans. Finish your work by painting your creations, and the masterpiece is done! Later you could visit the shop to buy sustainable handmade souvenirs for your loved ones before heading back to the hotel. Overnight in Hoi An

HOI AN DEPARTURE (B) Relish a healthy breakfast on the final day of your trip. Complete the hotel check-out formalities after which you can visit the local markets and buy souvenirs for your loved ones. Later, proceed for departure and board your flight back home. Trip Ends.

placesVisited: Ho Chi Minh city guided tour, lacquer workshop and markets, Vinh Long for Mekong Delta Cruise, Munir Ansay pagoda, Cai Rang floating market, ancient Vinh Trang pagoda, Cao Dai Holy See, Cu Chi Tunnels, Con Dao Island, all breakfasts and most lunches and dinners included
generalInfo:
Welcome to an 11-day journey through southern Vietnam, where vibrant culture, rich history, and stunning natural beauty await you. This culture and beach holiday takes you to five diverse destinations, each offering unique attractions. Enjoy the perfect balance of sightseeing and relaxation as you explore bustling Ho Chi Minh City, glide along the Mekong Delta, admire ancient pagodas, shop at local craft markets, visit the lively Cai Rang floating market, and unwind on the blissful island of Con Dao.

Your adventure begins in Ho Chi Minh City, a metropolis that beautifully blends the old and the new. After settling into your hotel, embark on a guided orientation that takes you to significant sites, including the History Museum, where you can learn about the fascinating Oc Eo civilization. The Museum of War Remnants offers a thought-provoking perspective on the American War, revealing the resilience of the Vietnamese spirit. As you wander through Ben Thanh Market, you’ll find local goods, making it the perfect spot to pick up souvenirs and sample street food. A visit to the serene Jade Emperor Temple provides a moment of tranquility, showcasing intricate carvings and local spiritual practices.

Next, head to the Mekong Delta, where a leisurely boat cruise takes you to Vinh Long. Here, explore lush fruit orchards and witness traditional cottage industries, including a family-run brick kiln. The journey continues to Can Tho, where you’ll visit the remarkable Munir Ansay Pagoda, an architectural gem with Khmer influences. The vibrant Cai Rang floating market awaits, offering a true taste of local life as you navigate bustling boats filled with fresh produce.

Returning to Ho Chi Minh City, you’ll venture into the historical Cu Chi tunnels, a fascinating labyrinth that played a crucial role during the war. A visit to the Cao Dai Holy See provides insight into one of Vietnam’s unique religions, where you can witness the colorful noon ceremony.

From there, the tour takes a relaxing turn as you fly to Con Dao Island, an untouched paradise known for its stunning beaches and vibrant marine life. With minimal infrastructure and a commitment to eco-tourism, Con Dao allows you to escape the crowds and connect with nature. You’ll have several days to unwind, snorkel, or dive among coral reefs, while learning about the island’s poignant history as a former prison colony. Guided walks through the national park reveal diverse flora and fauna, encouraging a deeper appreciation for this breathtaking environment.

This itinerary is only a suggestion; we understand each traveller has unique interests. If you wish to modify any aspects of the journey, just let us know. You can enjoy this trip any time of the year, with May to September considered low season and October to April being peak season, especially around Christmas and New Year when demand is higher.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Ho Chi Minh City. Arriving at Tan Son Nhat airport in Ho Chi Minh City. You’ll be met and driven to your hotel. You’ll have time to relax after your journey. You’ll spend the night in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ho Chi Minh City Orientation. After breakfast, your guide will arrive to show you around Ho Chi Minh City. You’ll visit the History Museum where there is a special exhibition of the 5th century ‘Oc Eo’ civilisation. The Museum of War Remnants provides a very partial, but riveting, perspective of the ‘American War’: not for the squeamish! The huge Ben Thanh market, one of the liveliest areas of Ho Chi Minh City, is packed with every conceivable commodity. You’ll also call in at the Jade Emperor Temple. It’s one of the best Taoist temples in Vietnam, with superb effigies, remarkable carved panels of the descent to Hell and somewhat incongruous terrapin and tortoise sanctuaries. You’ll finish your day with a visit to a lacquer workshop to see the complex processes and meticulous workmanship involved in this traditional Vietnamese craft product. You’ll spend the night in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ho Chi Minh City/Cai Be/Can Tho After escaping from Ho Chi Minh City’s urban sprawl, you’ll travel to Cai Be. After approx. 2.5 hours’ drive, you’ll arrive at Cai Be pier. You’ll take a boat trip to visit the Cai be floating market. The boat cruise will also take you to visit some of the handicraft industries cottage on the bank of the river like: coconut candy, rice crackers and a honey bee farm. After leaving these places you will be straight to Tan Phong Island where you’ll visit many fruit orchards like durian, rambuttan, Longan, Plum, Jackfruit (seasonal), you can pick and taste some of the fruits as you wish. Continuing to Mr. Nam On, where you’ll learn of the traditional instruments and enjoy the traditional folk song show performance by the local artists on the island. Farewell Mr. Nam On, you’ll take a small sampan to the zig zag small canal to the Mekong Ecolodge where you’ll have some cooking class of local dishes of the Mekong area, try hand for this fun activity and you will amaze of your cooking skill before enjoying the lunch. You’ll have a short break then you will take the bicycles to start exploring and taking part in some activities with the local people such as learning how to knit water hyacinth, making rice paper cake, nail polish tool by the bamboo. You can try your hand to any process as you wish. Farewell to these villagers’ houses, you’ll drive to Can Tho, the capital of the Mekong delta region. You’ll spend the night in Can Tho.

Can Tho/Ho Chi Minh City. After breakfast and a boat cruise you’ll arrive at Cai Rang floating market on the Mekong Delta. Both the journey and the market provide insights into the rural Mekong Delta lifestyle. On your return to Ho Chi Minh City, you’ll call in at the beautiful and ancient Vinh Trang pagoda, 3 km from My Tho centre. You’ll arrive in Ho Chi Minh City in the late afternoon with time to freshen up in the hotel.

Ho Chi Minh City/Cu Chi/Ho Chi Minh City. A morning drive will take you to visit the famous Cu Chi tunnels, a Byzantine maze of underground passages, chambers, rooms and booby traps used by both the Vietminh and the Viet Cong to suddenly materialise as if from nowhere, launch a lightning ambush, and vanish equally rapidly. From there, you’ll drive to The Cao Dai Holy See, an architectural ‘tour de force’ and the spiritual heart of one of the world’s newest religions. You’ll arrive in time for the noon ceremony. After lunch at local restaurant, you’ll drive back to Ho Chi Minh City.

Ho Chi Minh City/Con Dao. You will be picked up at good time for a drive to Tan Son Nhat airport and board the flight to Con Dao, where you will have car pick-up to your hotel for relaxing rest of the day.
Con Dao Island: Free time and Relax on beach.
Con Dao/Ho Chi Minh City. You’ll be picked up at good time for a return flight to Ho Chi Minh city, thence to connect your departure flight..

tourName: Vietnam diving & mountain biking adventure holiday
placesVisited: Hanoi, motorbike tour of Hanoi, kayaking and overnight boat cruise in Ha Long Bay, Sapa ethnic market, Nam Cang village, Nam Than village, Sin Chai village homestay, Nha Trang, Whale Island, diving, snorkelling and boat cruises on Nha Trang Bay
generalInfo:
his 14-day holiday in Vietnam takes you on an adventurous journey off the beaten path, blending cultural encounters with thrilling outdoor activities. You’ll bike, kayak, and even try scuba diving, all guided by experienced professionals when necessary. Alongside these active pursuits, you’ll experience colourful ethnic culture, bustling yet remote markets, scenic boat cruises, and the chance to get to know local people through immersive homestays.

The adventure kicks off in the North, beginning in Hanoi. A city rich in history and energy, Hanoi offers a perfect introduction to Vietnamese culture. A motorbike tour takes you through the city's highlights, from the peaceful Temple of Literature to Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum, and into the labyrinthine Old Quarter, where you’ll sample street food and soak up the vibrant atmosphere. You’ll also enjoy a traditional Water Puppetry show, a charming art form showcasing rural life.

From Hanoi, you’ll head to Ha Long Bay, a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its striking limestone karsts. Here, you’ll kayak through hidden sea caves and islands, paddle in serene waters, and enjoy a fresh seafood feast on board a wooden junk boat. Spend the night on the water, surrounded by the calm of the bay, before returning to Hanoi and taking an overnight sleeper train to Lao Cai for the next stage of the adventure.

In the Sapa region, immerse yourself in the natural beauty and rich culture of the mountains. Biking through Muong Hoa Valley, you’ll pass rice terraces and visit villages home to the Hmong, Giay, and Red Dao ethnic communities. Highlights include lunch in a Tay village and a stay in a traditional stilt house in Sin Chai, where a shared meal and cultural exchange offer genuine insight into local life. Vibrant markets brimming with traditional costumes and local produce are also part of the experience.

Travel south to Nha Trang to relax in a mud bath at Thap Ba hot spring spa and take a private boat trip on the Cai River, visiting local islands and snorkelling among coral reefs at Mun Island. There’s also time to explore a fishing village and enjoy fresh seafood on a quiet beach.

The final part of your adventure takes you to Whale Island, a secluded retreat perfect for unwinding after days of exploration. Stay in simple bamboo bungalows and choose to dive among coral reefs, snorkel, windsurf, or relax on the sandy beaches. Throughout, all domestic travel is arranged for comfort and convenience. Accommodation ranges from first-class to mid-range, with options to extend your stay, making this holiday a perfect balance of adventure, culture, and relaxation. This tour can easily be extended to include trekking, more time in Ho Chi Minh City, or anything else that interests you.

dayInfo.description: Ha Noi arrival (Dinner (D)) Arriving at Noi Bai airport in Hanoi, you'll be met and driven to your hotel. You'll have time to relax after your journey before a welcome dinner at a good restaurant in an old colonial building. The evening is free – if you're not too tired, you'll be able to wander around Hanoi's famous Hoan Kiem Lake, enjoy a Vietnamese coffee in an open air café and feel the atmosphere of Vietnam's remarkable capital city. Your overnight stay will be in Ha Noi

Motor biking in Hanoi (Breakfast (B), Lunch (L), Guide (G)) Visits to the sights of Hanoi from the back of a motorbike: Van Mieu (the Temple of Literature - the first university in Vietnam dating back to the 11th century), and the centre of Ha Noi, including the Hoan Kiem Lake, the Ngoc Son temple and the bustling Old Quarter with its eclectic mix of architectural styles - traditional 'tube' houses, religious buildings, colonial houses, vernacular dwellings and modern concrete edifices. In the afternoon, you'll visit the homes and studios of traditional artists or, alternatively, modern abstract painters and sculptors. Your overnight stay will be in Ha Noi.

Kayaking in Ha Long (B, L, D, G) After an early breakfast, you’ll leave for Ha Long Bay, one of the most spectacular UNESCO World Heritage Areas and the world’s largest marine limestone ‘karst’ landscape. Weather and tide permitting, you’ll be able to swim, fish and paddle in a kayak to the rocky islands to explore sea-level caves. The silence, broken only by the lapping of the water and the cries of sea birds, is a truly memorable experience. For your two-day Ha Long excursion, you'll board one of the best quality boats on the Bay. . The boats vary in size so you're likely to be joining other travellers for the cruise. Your cabin will be furnished with twin bunks, an air-conditioner, pillows, white cotton sheets, and an en suite toilet and shower. All your meals, usually based on fresh seafood, will be provided on board.

Kayaking in Ha Long (B, L, D, G) You'll cruise and kayak to some of Ha Long Bay's little-visited islands, followed by lunch on board. The boat will dock around noon after which you'll return to Ha Noi. After dinner, and an opportunity for a shower and freshen-up, you'll be driven to Hanoi Station to board the overnight sleeper train to Sapa. Your overnight stay will be on the train.

Sapa ethnic market (B, L, G) You'll be met at Lao Cai station and be taken by jeep to an ethnic market. After a picnic lunch, you'll return to Lao Cai and continue your journey into the mountains to Sapa, a small town perched on the mountainside opposite Mt. Fan Si Pan, Vietnam's highest peak. You'll arrive in Sapa in the late afternoon, with time to relax before dinner. Your overnight stay will be in Sapa

Cycling in Sapa (B, L, D, G) A 2½hr morning drive will take you to Nam Cang village (Dao ethnic group). From there, you’ll cycle to Nam Than village (H’mong ethnic group), set in a scenic valley. Your lunch will be prepared by our experienced guide. Afterwards, a longer cycle ride of about two hours will take you to Sin Chai village. There, you’ll have dinner and sleep overnight in a ‘stilt’ house. Your overnight stay will be in a local homestay

Sapa - to Ha Noi (B, L, G) Another two-hour cycle ride gets you to Ban Ho village, a refreshing splash-around in a clear mountain spring, and a welcome stream-side picnic lunch. In the afternoon, you'll be picked up to return to Sapa and, later in the evening, to Lao Cai station by jeep to catch the overnight train to Ha Noi.
Free day in Ha Noi (B, G) After you arrive in Ha Noi in the early morning, you'll be met and driven to your hotel. The rest of the day is free. Your overnight stay will be in Ha Noi.

Ha Noi to Nha Trang (B, L, G) After breakfast, you'll fly to Nha Trang, be greeted by a Haivenu representative and be driven to your hotel. After checking-in, you'll board a boat to cruise upstream on the Cai River, visiting rural areas engaged in a variety of cottage industries. After lunch, you can relax in the sensual pleasure of a mud bath at a hot spring. Your overnight stay will be in Nha Trang.

Snorkelling in Nha Trang (B, L, G) This is one of the rare occasions that we involve out guests in commercial 'touristy' activities, because this one is great fun. A whole-day Nha Trang boat cruise is something of an institution on the Vietnam tourist trail, and takes you to Mun Island for snorkelling and around the bay to visit some of the other islands. There'll be a seafood and fruit lunch on board, followed by homespun entertainment and a bottomless 'floating wine bar'. Of course, if you don't fancy a jolly 'party' atmosphere with a group of strangers, we can arrange a private boat tour for you instead. Your overnight stay will be in Nha Trang.

Nha Trang to Whale Island (B, DP) In the morning, you'll be picked up to drive to the Van Phong Gulf and a speedboat to cross to Whale Island. It's a 'get-away-from it all' hideaway about 80km north of Nha Trang. The only building on an isolated island, the Whale Island resort is designed to be unobtrusive and ecologically-friendly. It's small and basic but exclusive and comfortable – and therefore comparatively expensive, but all meals, transfers to the island and a motorboat for snorkelling are all included. You can dive at Whale Island – the coral is considered better than in Nha Trang. If you want to dive, you'll have a review dive in the afternoon. Your overnight stay will be at the Whale Island resort.

Diving off Whale Island (B each day) You'll have time for two days of diving with Whale Island's Five Star PADI Diving Centre. The cost of diving is not included: you can choose a package to suit you and pay locally, or if you prefer, we can book on your behalf. If you don't want to dive, there's swimming, snorkelling, fishing, sailing to nearby deserted sandy beaches, wandering around the island, and relaxing on the sun-loungers. Your overnight stay will be in the Whale Island resort.

Whale Island to Ho Chi Minh City (B, DP) The Whale Island staff will take care of your transfer from the resort to Nha Trang airport. From there you'll fly to Ho Chi Minh City for your transfer or departure flight from Tan Son Nhat airport.

generalInfo:
Vietnam Experience is our premium 12 or 15 day group tour.

With epic premium accommodation and lots of amazing inclusions, its perfect for those wanting to see the best of Vietnam in style.

12 DAY: Hanoi - Hoi An
15 DAY: Hanoi - Ho Chi Minh

You’ll explore Hanoi on a traditional rickshaw, stay with locals in the lush mountainside of Sapa, sail through Ha Long Bay, learn to cook tasty Vietnamese food, discover traditional villages in the Mekong Delta, and learn some history at the Cu Chi tunnels, all while staying in upgraded accommodation.

Plus you’ll have an awesome group leader with you from the moment you step off the plane, an instant group of friends to share your adventure with and help with your onward travel. Get ready for the trip of a lifetime!

HIGHLIGHTS

- Enjoy premium accommodation including upgraded traditional homestays and four-star hotels
- Immerse yourself in the buzz of Hanoi on a walking and rickshaw tour
- Trek through the lush, rolling mountainsides of Sapa
- Cruise overnight through the magnificent Ha Long Bay
- Be captured by the charm of Hoi An
- Learn about local village life in the Mekong Delta and discover the history of the Cu Chi tunnels (15 Day Only)

INCLUSIONS

- Personal Airport Pickup To The Hotel 24/7
- All Transport & Internal Flights
- Awesome Group Leader
- Walking & Rickshaw Tour of Hanoi
- Night Out in Hanoi
- Sapa Mountain-Side Accommodation
- Sapa Trekking with Locals
- Overnight Boat Trip on Ha Long Bay
- Kayaking
- Local Homestay Experience
- Bicycle Tour of Ninh Binh
- River Boat Trip
- Dragon Mountain Viewpoint
- Cooking Class
- Traditional Crab Fishing Basket Boat Tour
- Lantern making class
- Overnight Mekong Delta Experience (15 Day only)
- Cu Chi Tunnels Tour (15 Day only)
- Local Village Visit (15 Day only)
- Help with Onward Travel

dayInfo.description: ARRIVE IN HANOI: We’ll meet you at the airport and take you to your hotel. You’ll have plenty of time to rest after your flight before meeting up with your group and getting excited for the experiences to come!

RICKSHAW EXPLORING: Immerse yourself in the bustle of Hanoi with a walking and rickshaw tour of the capital. Togeth-er we’ll explore the themed trading streets, soak up the intriguing culture and stay fuelled with delicious street food. Tonight we’ll head out for dinner and drinks to experience Hanoi’s night-life.

SAPA TREKKING: This morning we’ll take a VIP limousine bus to the rolling hills of Sapa. We’ll learn from our local guide how different ethnic groups live peacefully together while retaining their customs, then begin our trek deep into the Muong Hoa Valley. Passing rice paddies, mountain views and water buffalo, we might get a little muddy, but it’s all part of the fun!
VILLAGES & MOUNTAINS: Today we trek through terraced hills and discover local villages. This afternoon we'll enjoy our beautiful mountain-side hotel and take in the serenity of our surroundings.

EXPLORE SAPA TOWN: Explore Sapa at your own pace, or take the cable car up to Fan Si Pan peak, also known as the roof of Indochina. This afternoon we’ll jump back in the VIP limousine bus back to Hanoi.

HA LONG BAY OVERNIGHT BOAT: We’ll head straight to the stunning natural wonder of Ha Long Bay and board our luxurious boat for the night. Known for its emerald waters, magical caves and towering limestone mountains covered in rainforest, we can kayak and sunbathe on deck with a drink in hand.

TRAVEL TO NINH BINH: Today we head south to the beautiful countryside of Ninh Binh. This evening we’ll check in to our unique traditional homestay and watch the sunset whilst relaxing in our riverside bungalows.

EXPLORE NINH BINH: We’ll hop on bicycles to ride through rice paddies, then take a local rowboat through rivers and caves. This afternoon we’ll tackle the iconic Dragon Mountain viewpoint for jaw-dropping views over the rural landscape. We'll then board our surprisingly comfortable overnight train bound for Hoi An.

EXPLORE HOI AN: Hoi An is full of markets, colourful alleyways and lanterns lighting up the streets. Here you can wander the streets, sip a drink by the canal or get measured for custom clothes at a local tailor. Tonight we’ll go out for dinner and drinks to soak up the buzzing nightlife of the town and also experience the iconic lantern boats.

BASKET FISHING & COOKING CLASS: Be guided by local fisherman through coconut groves and learn the art of crab fishing before trying your hand at a traditional Vietnamese cooking class. The afternoon is free for you to relax by the pool, get a massage or try on your new tailored clothes.
LANTERN MAKING & BEACH DAY: This morning we’ll learn how to make lanterns. We’ll then enjoy a chilled day at a beach club before enjoying our final night in Vietnam together!

HO CHI MINH CITY: Enjoy the last bits of Hoi An this morning before we catch an internal flight to Ho Chi Minh City. We’ll head straight out to the markets for dinner then up to a rooftop bar to treat ourselves to a drink.
MEKONG DELTA: Today we’ll explore the lush beauty of the Mekong Delta, learn how locals live on the river and check in to a traditional family-run homestay for the night.

CU CHI TUNNELS: Today we learn some history at the Cu Chi tunnels, a fascinating network of hand-dug tunnels that played an important role in the Vietnam War. We’ll arrive back to Ho Chi Minh city this afternoon before heading out for our farewell dinner and drinks!
CHECK OUT: Your amazing 15-day adventure comes to an end. You can either check out and make your way home or continue your travels around Vietnam or Asia with help from your group leader.

generalInfo: An Amazing Vietnam Family Holiday is a great family adventure that you remember for the rest of your life. You will see the most spectacular natural sceneries, such as Halong Bay and Ninh Binh, explore off-the-beaten-path destinations in Mai Chau, learn something new, and soak up the sun relaxing on the white sand beach under reclining palms in Phu Quoc. We have prepared many fun activities for you - from trekking along beautiful villages to learning local crafts, cycling in the countryside, and flying kites. This trip is the best way to explore diverse Vietnam and spend a wonderful time together.

dayInfo.description: HANOI ARRIVAL Upon arrival at Noi Bai International Airport, after clearing all customs procedures, please proceed to the exit gate and look for your driver, who will be waiting in the lobby, holding the signboard with your name. If you cannot find the driver, go to the Airport information counter to call the number provided in the confirmation voucher for assistance. You will be transferred to your hotel in the Old Quarter by private car. Overnight in Hanoi.

HANOI SIGHTSEEING AND COOKING CLASS WITH MASTER CHEF (B/L) Today you will see the most exciting parts of charming Hanoi. Your tour guide will share with you interesting stories about Hanoi's history and life. Start your tour by having a drink in the old coffee shop and learning about the daily life of locals. You will visit Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, with his house and one pillar pagoda. Then spend time in the tranquil Temple Of Literature. In the afternoon, after a relaxing time at your hotel, meet Chef Ai, a passionate culinary expert. She will take you to a local market and show you how to select the freshest and most typical ingredients for cooking Vietnamese food. Then you will head to her house to enjoy a hands-on experience in cooking delicious Vietnamese meals. Overnight in Hanoi.

HANOI – TRAVEL TO MAI CHAU – CYCLING IN THE LOCAL VILLAGE (B/L) In the morning we will depart Hanoi for a scenic 4hr drive southwest to Mai Chau. Located in Hoa Binh Province, Mai Chau is famed for its splendid vistas of mountains and valleys surrounded by lush landscapes and stilt houses, inhabited mainly by the White Thai ethnic group. Upon arrival in Mai Chau, check in at Mai Chau Ecolodge. Then walk or cycle to the hamlet of Lac to enjoy a traditional home-cooked lunch. Continue cycling for a couple of hours through the beautiful valley of Mai Chau. Your guide will facilitate chats with local hill tribe people to learn about their daily lives including planting rice, herding buffalos, and building traditional houses. Overnight in Mai Chau.

WALKING AT MAI HICH VILLAGE (B/L) After breakfast at Mai Chau Eco Lodge, you will take about 40 minutes drive off-the-beaten path to Mai Hich village. Enjoy the cool mountain breeze on a 2-hour walk along scenic mountain trails with opportunities to stop and observe local traditions. Spend the rest of the time in the cozy village seeing the authentic local lifestyle and enjoying a cup of coffee (soft drinks for kids) with the friendly villagers. Overnight in Mai Chau.

MAI CHAU – TRAVEL TO NINH BINH – VAN LONG NATURE RESERVE (B/L) After breakfast, take a 3-hour drive to Ninh Binh province. Today you will see the spectacular landscapes of limestone karst peaks permeated with valleys and rice paddies. Upon arrival, enjoy a lunch at a local restaurant. In the afternoon, enjoy the rowing boat trip through picturesque scenery with spectacular mountain ranges surrounded by a vast expanse of water. After the boat trip, take a slow journey along the rice fields and cozy countryside on the buffalo cart. Then check in at a beautiful sustainable resort with a nice garden and enjoy leisure time. Overnight in Ninh Binh.

CRUISING IN THE SPECTACULAR HA HONG BAY (B/L/D) After breakfast at the hotel, we will take you for a 3,5 hours drive to the famous Halong Bay along the scenic road. Upon arrival at the harbor, you will board the cruise and proceed with the check-in formalities. And get ready to explore the breathtaking sceneries of Halong Bay, where thousands of limestone islands jut out of the emerald sea, sculpted into bizarre shapes. Enjoy the delicious lunch while the cruise is making its way to a secret place, where you can explore the karst formations closer by kayaking. Then get back on a boat and take part in boat activities and enjoy the sunset views before having dinner. In case of bad weather, when the boat will be not allowed to leave the port, the tour could be canceled without notice. We will consider other replacement tours or a refund based on the specific circumstances. Overnight in Ha Long Bay.

HALONG BAY – BACK TO HANOI – FLY TO HUE (B/L) The sun rises on Halong in the morning, and a Tai Chi lesson is awaiting you before light breakfast. After breakfast, you could take a short trip to visit one of the most beautiful caves in Halong Bay. When you are back, complete the check-out formalities and enjoy brunch while the boat is making its way back to the harbor. Then we will transfer you to the airport for your flight to Hue. Upon arrival at the airport, you will be transferred to a nice resort located in the tranquil countryside. The rest of the day is free for leisure. Overnight in Hue.

HUE SIGHTSEEING AND LEARNING TO MAKE A KITE WITH A LOCAL ARTISAN (B/L) Once the imperial capital of the Nguyen Lords from the 17th to the 19th centuries, Hue remains the royal charm, and today you will explore the most exciting historical places of this charming city. Hop on the cyclo, a traditional Vietnamese mode of transport, and head to the Imperial Citadel to see the royal family used to live. Then visit the iconic Thien Mu Pagoda, Hue’s best-preserved religious monument. Have lunch and return to your hotel for a short rest. In the afternoon, we will visit the local artisan Mr. Cu at his house. Chat with him to understand the history of kite-flying traditions in Hue and his passion for this art. Then learn how to create a kite yourself. If the weather permits, practice flying the kite. Overnight in Hue.

PRIVATE TRANSFER FROM HUE TO HOI AN (B) Have breakfast at the hotel, and enjoy your leisure time before we transfer you to Hoi An. We will take one of the most scenic roads in the world - Hai Van Pass with overviewing mountains and beautiful sea. Upon arrival in Hoi An, check-in at the hotel and enjoy free time resting after the transfer. Overnight in Hoi An.

HOI AN WALING TOUR AND BOAT TRIP ALONG THU BON RIVER (B) A colorful lantern is a symbol of Hoi An, we are sure you and your kids will love to have it as a souvenir, so why not make it on your own? This morning we will take you for a walk through the cozy alleys of the Hoi An Old Town to see its most interesting attractions, such as the Japanese Covered Bridge, Tan Ky Old House, Phuc Kien Assembly Hall, and Cantonese Assembly Hall. Then we will stroll around the lively central market before hopping on the boat to cruise along the Thu Bon River for up-close views of fishing boats and country villages before returning to your hotel. Overnight in Hoi An.

LEARNING CRAFTS AT THE DRIFTWOOD VILLAGE – FLY TO HO CHI MINH CITY (B) Today you will spend time in the beautiful village surrounded by rice paddies and learn about fascinating carpentry art. Take a morning drive to visit the Driftwood Village. It is a community of local artisans who create beautiful art from driftwood collected from the nearby beaches. Learn about the local carpentry traditions and listen to the story of the village. Many local artisans use sustainable materials and practices, which makes these crafts even more special. Learn the basic technics to use the chisel and try your hands at making your own craft under the guidance of our skillful artisans. Finish your work by painting your creations, and the masterpiece is done! Then we will transfer you to the airport for your flight to Ho Chi Minh. Upon arrival to Ho Chi Minh City, you will be picked up and escorted to the hotel to check in and stay overnight. Overnight in Ho Chi Minh City.

HO CHI MINH SIGHTSEEING (B) Today you will see the different sides of this cosmopolitan city previously known as Saigon. Start your tour at the bustling Chinese district of Cholon, where you will visit Vietnam’s first traditional medicine museum, and Ben Thanh Market to see the wide variety of goods for sale. In the afternoon, depending on your preference, visit either the War Remnants Museum or History Museum. Then continue to the former Presidential Palace. Finish the day with a stroll around the city’s colonial architecture, including the Old Saigon Post Office, Dong Khoi Street (formerly Rue Catinat), Continental Hotel, Opera House, and City Hall. Overnight in Ho Chi Minh City.

HO CHI MINH – EXPLORE THE COUNTRYSIDE OF MEKONG DELTA (B/L/D) After breakfast at the hotel, depart to Coco Riverside Lodge in Vung Liem. The trip will take about 2,5 hours. Upon arrival, enjoy delicious lunch at the resort and rest for a while. In the afternoon, join the cycling tour around the village. Visit Mr. Cong at his house and learn to make a popular local snack pop rice, which later will be given as a gift to locals or children at school. See the daily life of the villagers: how the animals are raised and how locals collect the biogas to use it as sustainable fuel for cooking. If possible, you can visit the duck farm and one of the fruit plantations to taste fresh tropical fruits before returning to the lodge. Here we will visit our neighbor, who is a Vietnam War veteran to listen to the stories of his life. In the evening, join the cooking lesson before having dinner. Overnight in Vinh Long.

BOAT TRIP IN MEKONG DELTA – FLY TO PHU QUOC (B) In the morning, after breakfast, we will enjoy a boat trip and see the busy life of the Mekong River. We also visit the Cao Dai temple and visit the workshops to see how the coconut fibers are processed into various products. Then head to the resort to get ready for your flight to Phu Quoc. Overnight in Phu Quoc.

PHU QUOC FAMILY FREE AT LEISURE (B) Phu Quoc is a little piece of paradise and a great place for water activities. Spend your free day relaxing on the beach under the palms and have fun swimming and playing in the water. If your kids are older they might like to go snorkeling, too. A great spot for families is Vinpearl Land Amusement Park, with so many fun activities for kids and adults. Take your swimwear along as there's a waterpark there, too. If you and your kids are animal lovers you could also visit Vinpearl Safari Phu Quoc, where you will see various wild animals. Nature lovers will enjoy taking a picnic at the beautiful Suoi Trang Waterfall, admiring the beauty of the forest and mountains, and hiking through the jungle. Overnight in Phu Quoc.

PHU QUOC FAMILY FREE AT LEISURE (B) Phu Quoc is a little piece of paradise and a great place for water activities. Spend your free day relaxing on the beach under the palms and have fun swimming and playing in the water. If your kids are older they might like to go snorkeling, too. A great spot for families is Vinpearl Land Amusement Park, with so many fun activities for kids and adults. Take your swimwear along as there's a waterpark there, too. If you and your kids are animal lovers you could also visit Vinpearl Safari Phu Quoc, where you will see various wild animals. Nature lovers will enjoy taking a picnic at the beautiful Suoi Trang Waterfall, admiring the beauty of the forest and mountains, and hiking through the jungle. Overnight in Phu Quoc.

PHU QUOC DEPARTURE (B) Relish a healthy breakfast on the final day of your trip. Complete the hotel check-out formalities after which you can visit the local markets and buy souvenirs for your loved ones. Later, proceed for departure and board your flight back home. Trip Ends.

generalInfo:
Vietnam is a destination that truly has it all – from breathtaking landscapes and vibrant cities to towering mountains and sparkling emerald bays. On our 13-day Vietnam family group tour, we’ll take you on a journey to experience the very best this incredible country has to offer.

Starting in the bustling streets of Ho Chi Minh City, you’ll get a taste of modern Vietnamese life before heading to the historic charm of Hoi An, known for its picturesque streets and rich cultural heritage. Along the way, you’ll immerse yourself in local culture with unique craft workshops, kayak through clear blue rivers, and stay at cozy, locally-owned farm-stays that offer a genuine experience of rural life.

And, to top off your adventure, we’ll spend two days cruising around the world-famous Halong Bay, where you can soak up the stunning scenery and relax aboard a traditional wooden boat. This 13-day tour is designed to give your family an unforgettable experience in one of Southeast Asia’s most captivating countries.

What's Included

All transportation & accommodation within Vietnam throughout your entire tour.
A number of meals throughout your tour.
Welcome dinner (Ho Chi Minh City)
Cu Chi Tunnels visit (Ho Chi Minh City)
City walking tour (Ho Chi Minh City)
Lantern-making workshop (Hoi An)
Hoi An ancient town tour (Hoi An)
Cycle tour of Chay Lap farm (Phong Nha)
Kayaking at Chay Lap watersports center (Phong Nha)
Hoan Kiem Lake visit & Old Quarter visit (Hanoi)
Halong Bay 2-day, 1-night cruise – including lunch, dinner & brunch, canoeing, Cap La Island visit and sunset party, Thien Canh Son Cave visit, morning tai chi class (Hanoi)
Farewell dinner (Hanoi)

dayInfo.description: Ho Chi Minh City: Welcome to Vietnam and the beginning of your family group tour! You’ll meet your fellow travellers and your Adventure Leader at your hotel around 5pm today. During this meeting, you’ll get an introduction to what the next 13 days have in store, along with important safety information and tips for adjusting to life in Vietnam. Afterwards, we’ll head out for dinner at a local restaurant to officially welcome you to this beautiful country. This will be a great opportunity to try some delicious regional cuisine and get to know the other families who will be joining you on your adventure.

Ho Chi Minh City: We’re starting the day bright and early with a trip to the Cu Chi Tunnels. Located just outside the city, these tunnels were built during the Vietnam War as a strategic defense against better-equipped American and South Vietnamese forces. It’s a fascinating visit and an important part of Vietnam’s history. You’ll return to your hotel in the mid-afternoon, giving you some time to freshen up before heading out for a walking tour of the city. During the tour, you’ll have the chance to see the city’s most iconic landmarks and get a feel for its vibrant atmosphere. In the evening, if you’d like, you can join your group for dinner. And if you're still hungry after that, you can head out to a local night market for a snack to wrap up the day.

Ho Chi Minh City: Today is a free day for you to explore Ho Chi Minh at your own pace, but if you’re looking for some inspiration, we have several optional activities you can book: If you want to get off the beaten path, consider a day trip to the Mekong Delta. This day trip will take you from early morning until mid-afternoon. During your visit, you’ll row sampan boats along scenic canals, stroll through a small local village, explore traditional workshops, sample fresh fruit and honey tea, and enjoy lunch at a garden restaurant overlooking the beautiful countryside. For a taste of Vietnamese culture, join a drawing workshop this morning. You’ll learn about traditional Vietnamese art and have the chance to create a memorable souvenir of your time here. If your family loves food, a cooking class could be a fun option! Led by a local head chef, you’ll get hands-on experience cooking four delicious courses, while learning about the flavors and techniques that make up Vietnam’s culinary traditions. The experience also includes a visit to a local market. In the evening, you can opt for a relaxing cruise along the Saigon River. From the boat, you’ll get a unique perspective of the city’s iconic landmarks. Of course, feel free to ask your Adventure Leader for additional suggestions on how to make the most of your free day.

Hoi An: This morning, we’ll head to the airport and transfer to our next destination on the Vietnam family group tour – Hoi An! Our goal is to arrive and check in to our hotel by early afternoon. Once settled, we’ll dive into the local culture with a fun and hands-on experience – a lantern-making workshop! Hoi An is renowned for its vibrant lanterns, and now it’s your turn to create your very own to take home as a unique souvenir. Afterward, we’ll give you a tour of the Ancient Town. Wander through this UNESCO World Heritage Site with your Adventure Leader and explore the charming streets, historic architecture, and local shops at your own pace. This evening, you have the option to join us for the Hoi An Memories show. This spectacular performance brings the 400-year history of the town to life, featuring breathtaking lighting and sound effects that make for an unforgettable experience.

Hoi An: Today is yours to enjoy at your own pace, but as always, we have a range of optional activities for you to choose from. If you’re in need of a break, you can simply unwind on the beach, soaking up the beautiful views and getting some well-deserved rest and relaxation. Alternatively: You can take a full-day tour to Ba Na Hills. This tour includes a scenic cable car ride up to Ba Na Mountain, where you’ll explore the lush Le Jardin, ancient French villas, and the stunning Linh Ung Pagoda with its impressive 27m Buddha. Don’t miss the chance to reach the peak of Chua Mountain, where you’ll enjoy panoramic views of Da Nang city. If you’re craving more adventure, you can opt for a tour to the Cu Lao Cham islands, a UNESCO World Biosphere Reserve located just 20km off the coast of Hoi An. The islands offer pristine beaches, crystal-clear waters, and a fascinating ecosystem. For something uniquely Vietnamese, you could try a coconut basket boating experience. These traditional circular boats are used to navigate the serene, verdant rivers. Afterward, you’ll visit a local farm to learn about rural life in the area. This evening, if you’d like, you can join the group for dinner to wrap up your day.

Phong Nha: This morning, enjoy a relaxed breakfast at your own pace before we head to our next destination: Phong Nha. Our journey takes us to a unique and memorable stay at a local farmstay in Chay Lap, where you’ll experience life within a close-knit community. After checking in and settling in, we’ll gather for a delightful dinner at the farmstay’s restaurant, where you can savour delicious, locally-sourced dishes.

Phong Nha: Today, you have a couple of fantastic options for how to spend your day. If you’re looking for a quieter day, feel free to relax by the farmstay’s outdoor pool and lounge area. However, if you're in the mood for adventure, consider: Joining us on a one-day tour of Phong Nha National Park, where we’ll visit the spectacular Paradise Cave and Dark Cave. Don’t forget your swimsuits, as there will be plenty of opportunities for adventure, including a zip line or a kayaking experience. In the evening, we’ll head out on a night safari, where you’ll explore the local jungle in an electric car, searching for rare animals and insects. If you prefer, you can also opt for a peaceful dinner at the farmstay’s restaurant to wind down after the day’s activities.

Phong Nha to Hanoi: Tonight, we’ll transfer to Hanoi, the next stop on our Vietnam family group tour – but not before we enjoy some final fun in Phong Nha! After breakfast, we’ll pick up bikes for a 2-hour cycle tour around Chay Lap farm. Still feeling energetic? Next, we’ll head to the local watersports centre to grab kayaks and explore the waters. Before we leave for Hanoi, you can opt to join us for a boat ride along the Chay River, offering a stunning view of Golden Hour and the sunset. In the evening, we’ll depart the farmstay and begin our overnight journey to Hanoi by train. (Note: A flight alternative is available – please contact us for more details.)

Hanoi: This morning, you’ll arrive in Hanoi and check into your next accommodation. After a bit of rest to recharge, we’ll take you out in the mid-afternoon to explore the beautiful Hoan Kiem Lake and the bustling Old Quarter. In the evening, you can opt to join your group for dinner and drinks at the night market in the Old Quarter. Alternatively, if you’re looking for a taste of local culture, we recommend heading to the traditional Water Puppet Show for a fascinating display of Vietnam’s cultural heritage.

Hanoi: Today is yours to enjoy however you wish. However, we’ve got some exciting options if you’re looking for inspiration: You can take a full-day trip to Ninh Binh, where you’ll explore the towering limestone karsts of Trang An, visit the Bai Dinh Pagoda, enjoy a group lunch, and take a traditional wooden boat to discover the local grottoes and caves. Alternatively, head into the Old Quarter for a pottery workshop, where you’ll learn to craft traditional Bat Trang ceramics and make your own unique piece to take home. In the afternoon, embark on a Jeep tour around Hanoi, taking in the city's most beautiful landmarks such as the French Quarter, the Opera House, and West Lake. Along the way, you’ll also have the chance to taste some of Hanoi's finest regional cuisine. If you prefer to spend your day at leisure, be sure to ask your Adventure Leader for recommendations on the best things to see and do!

Halong Bay: We’re starting early this morning as we head to one of the most stunning destinations in Vietnam – Halong Bay! Upon arrival, we’ll board our boat (where we’ll stay overnight) and enjoy a delicious lunch as we cruise towards Cap La Island. In the afternoon, you’ll have the chance to canoe across the crystal-clear waters and take a tender boat to explore the island. After some time on the island, we’ll gather for a fun party as the sun sets. Then, we’ll head back to our boat for dinner and relax for the night, taking in the incredible scenery around us.

Halong Bay: Wake up this morning to the peaceful sway of the boat in Halong Bay, just in time for a relaxing tai chi session on the sundeck or to simply enjoy the stunning sunrise over the bay’s remarkable landscape. After a quick snack, we’ll take you on an excursion to Thien Canh Son Cave, a beautiful hidden gem that you’ll have the chance to explore in the morning. Don’t worry about feeling hungry, as we’ll have you back on board by mid-morning for a delicious traditional Vietnamese brunch. Afterward, we’ll begin cruising back to port, where we’ll transfer you back to Hanoi. This evening, you’ll have some free time to relax, but we’ll gather everyone for a farewell dinner, where you can reflect on the wonderful experiences of your journey together.

Hanoi: Sadly, this morning marks the end of your Vietnam family tour. If you’d like assistance with getting back to the airport – or you’re planning on staying another night – let us know and we can assist you with your booking. Alternatively, if you’d like to stay on, you can book an additional 3-day, 2-night loop of Ha Giang! Find out more on this below.

Optional Extension - The Ha Giang Loop: If you're not quite ready to say goodbye to Vietnam, you can extend your adventure by adding an amazing loop of Ha Giang once your tour in Hanoi finishes. Here's what you can expect: Day 13: Hanoi to Ha Giang Start the day by exploring Hoan Kiem Lake and the rest of Hanoi in the morning. After lunch, you'll visit Hao Lo Prison in the afternoon, a significant historical site. In the evening, you can explore the bustling Old Quarter night market before boarding a sleeper bus that will take you to Ha Giang, where you'll arrive in the early morning. Day 14: Ha Giang & Bac Sum Pass After breakfast at your accommodation, we'll head toward Bac Sum Pass. Along the way, stop at Heaven’s Gate, an incredible gorge surrounded by mountains, and also visit Tam Son town. When we arrive at Yen Minh town, we’ll have lunch before continuing our journey to Dong Van via the Chin Khoanh Pass. As we travel through the afternoon, you’ll pass by stunning rice terraces and towering limestone rocks, with glimpses of local hill tribes working the land. We’ll also visit the Hmong King’s Palace, a century-old residence belonging to the King of the H’mong people, Vuong Chinh Duc. We’ll arrive in Dong Van late in the afternoon and check in to a cozy, family-owned hotel. After settling in, you’ll enjoy a delicious local Vietnamese dinner. The rest of the evening is yours to explore as you like. Day 15: Waterfalls & Textile-Making in Lung Tam: After breakfast, it's time to pack your swimsuits as we head to a nearby waterfall for a refreshing swim. Next, we’ll transfer to Lung Tam, a H’mong village, where you'll join local craftswomen in a textile-making workshop and create a unique souvenir. We'll then head to Quan Ba town to marvel at the stunning Nui Doi mountain before returning to Ha Giang for a few final hours of exploration. In the late afternoon, we’ll board a private bus to take us back to Hanoi, where we’ll arrive in the evening. Pricing per person: £550 This extended loop of Ha Giang offers an unforgettable journey through northern Vietnam’s remote landscapes and rich cultural heritage.

generalInfo:
We designed our Family Adventure in Vietnam to give you a taste of what makes this country such an exciting place to explore, and it’s filled with memorable experiences the whole family can enjoy together.

You’ll spend time immersed in nature, including the chance to spot wildlife on a night safari, and learn about Vietnam’s vibrant culture, both old and new, with immersive experiences like a day visiting a traditional water-puppet village. There’s time to unwind on the beaches of Hoi An, where you can choose to add a variety of family-friendly activities such as a cooking class, lantern-making or photography workshop, or a cycling and kayaking adventure.

Keep the kids active and engaged with gentle hikes to hill-tribe villages and a bike ride through the Mekong Delta, both of which offer wonderful opportunities to meet and connect with local communities. Add in some unique modes of travel, like an overnight train journey and a speedboat ride to the Cu Chi Tunnels, and you’ve got the perfect ingredients for an unforgettable family adventure.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Hanoi, where you’ll be greeted at the airport and taken to your hotel for check-in. The rest of the day is free to explore this vibrant metropolis that blends 1,000 years of living history with the modern energy of a major Asian city.

Your day begins with visits to the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum and the Temple of Literature, followed by an authentic Hanoian ph? lunch at a local restaurant. In the afternoon, explore Ngoc Son Temple before enjoying a relaxing cyclo ride around Hoan Kiem Lake and the Old Quarter, then return to your hotel for a free evening. If you’d like to delve deeper into Vietnamese culture and cuisine, you can add a hands-on cooking class with a market visit or a special home-hosted dinner with a local family. (B/L)

This morning, you’ll leave central Hanoi to visit a historic water-puppet village. Meet an artisan family in their workshop to learn about the craft’s 300-year history, watch a private performance, and even try operating the puppets yourself. The afternoon is free, with the optional choice of 3 hours ebiking around West Lake and Banana Island to glimpse another side to the city. After weaving through hidden alleys and empty dirt paths between the fields, you’ll return to your hotel around 16:30. (B/L)

Depart Hanoi at 08:00 for the 90km journey to Sung Village in Da Bac district, a community-led social enterprise that preserves authentic Dao Tien culture. After a traditional lunch with a local family, you’ll chat with neighbours about day to day life there, then take a gentle 6km forest walk to Mong Stream and continue by boat along the Da River to Mo Hem Village. Free time to swim or kayak before you share another delicious home-cooked dinner with your hosts and enjoy a local music performance, and perhaps try your hand at making bánh oc cakes. (B/L/D)

Start your day in Mo Hem by soaking in the cool morning air and sunrise over the lake. After breakfast learn more about Muong culture and everyday life, from stilt-house construction to bamboo-trap shrimp fishing. Then board a boat across the lake and continue by car to Cuc Phuong National Park, arriving after about three hours to check into a simple park run guesthouse. After dinner, join a park guide for a night safari into the forest in search of nocturnal wildlife such as civets, flying squirrels, lorises, and owls. (B/L/D)

After breakfast, explore further into Cuc Phuong National Park, beginning with a visit to the Endangered Primate Rescue Center to learn about vital conservation work for species such as Delacour’s langurs and gibbons. You’ll then set off on a 3–4 hour guided trek through dense rainforest, glimpsing ancient trees, unique flora and if you’re lucky rare wildlife, while your guide shares insights into the park’s ecosystem and history. Around 16:00, continue to the photogenic Bich Dong Pagoda before heading to Ninh Binh station for dinner and your 22:00 night train to Danang. (B/L)

Arrive at Da Nang station around noon and transfer to Hoi An, travelling along the coast road past rice fields, villages, lagoons and the scenic Hai Van Pass, where sweeping views of Lang Co Beach and Da Nang offer perfect photo opportunities. After checking in and enjoying a late lunch, the rest of the day is yours to relax or explore Hoi An’s charming old town or nearby beaches at your own pace. Hoi An is also known for its tailoring but working conditions can be unethical, so if you’re considering custom-made clothing, ask us about reputable shops beforehand. (B)

After an early breakfast, transfer to Danang for your morning flight to Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon). If your room is available you can check in early, then around 13:00 board a speedboat for a scenic upriver journey to the Cu Chi Tunnels, watching the scenery shift from urban skyline to lush jungle as you cruise along the Saigon River. Learn about what life was like for the Viet Cong guerrillas who fought underground in the cramped tunnels for months at a time. Return to the city by boat and arrive back at your hotel around 17:30 for a free evening. (B)

Depart Ho Chi Minh City for a two-hour drive to Vinh Long, passing through the fertile landscapes and never-ending busyness of river life that define the Mekong Delta. Meet your local guide and take a short boat ride to An Binh Island to visit a floating fish farm before beginning a leisurely cycling adventure through quiet roads lined with canals and fruit gardens, stopping at a local home for a delicious lunch. Afterward, continue cycling to visit a coconut candy workshop and a Cao Dai temple, then head to your family-run ecolodge to relax by the pool and enjoy a dinner of local specialties. (B)

After breakfast, take a boat to a peaceful area on the mainland and mount your bikes for a couple of hours easy riding beneath the jungle canopy. Along the way, you'll encounter cottage workshops, emerald rice fields, vegetable farms and local kids who wave as you pass. Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant before driving back to your hotel in Ho Chi Minh City around 17:00. (B/L)
All good things come to an end… sadly it’s time to pack up and head to the airport for your onwards flight, leaving Vietnam with lots of amazing memories and photos! (B)

placesVisited: Hanoi, Halong Bay cruise, Da Nang, Hoi An, Cua Dai beach, overnight train from Da Nang to Nha Trang, Whale Island, Ho Chi Minh City, Cu Chi Tunnels, Mekong Delta guesthouse, Optional visit to Dam Sen Water Park, Included activities include: evening cooking class, kayaking, cycling
generalInfo:
This two week family holiday in Vietnam places you in a small group with other families as you embark on a safe, enjoyable and incredibly interactive adventure in Southeast Asia.

From Hanoi and Halong Bay in the north through to Ho Chi Minh City and the Mekong Delta in the south this tour of Vietnam features a variety of classic locations alongside lots of off the beaten track settings and included activities.

Prepare your family for an eclectic assault on the senses as you explore city streets, cycle through countryside and kayak past the limestone peaks dotted across Halong Bay. There’s no better way for families to travel other than with children of a similar age and parents who wish to build interactive and educational experiences into an efficient two week itinerary.

Boat trips along the Mekong Delta, snorkelling trips around Whale Island and bike tours through lush green rice paddies, close to Hoi An, all help this fabulous family holiday take shape with an exciting overnight train ride ensuring every day promises a different tale to tell.

Chopsticks at the ready everyone as this is one family adventure that will expand cultural horizons as well as tantalising taste buds as you get to experience every aspect of Vietnam with bffs that you haven’t met yet.

dayInfo.description: Begin your adventure in Hanoi, the culture-rich capital of Vietnam. The day is free to recover from the flight or stroll among broad tree-lined avenues dating from the French period. Around 6pm, say xin chào to your tour leader and fellow travellers, when we gather as a group for the first time to get to know each other and learn more about the adventures ahead. Your tour leader then ensures a big Vietnamese welcome by arranging dinner at a local restaurant, where your children will have their first opportunity to master their chopstick skills. Want to spend more time in Hanoi? Secure pre-tour hotel nights through your sales representative. Accommodation: Babylon Grand Hotel & Spa (or similar)

We take a city tour this morning, which will include a visit to the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum area to see his stilt house and visit the One Pillar Pagoda. We'll also visit the Temple of Literature and the Hoa Lo Prison (also known as the Hanoi Hilton). After, we take a cyclo (bicycle taxi) through the Old Quarter, which is home to the 36 Streets, each named for the products sold on it, such as Silk Street, Gold Street and Paper Street. The remainder of the day is at leisure. We recommend strolling around Hoan Kiem Lake, stopping for a coffee or ice cream at one of the many waterside cafes. In the evening, there is the option to enjoy a water puppet performance, a classic Hanoi experience. Accommodation: Babylon Grand Hotel & Spa (or similar)

We start early for the approximate four-hour journey to Ha Long Bay, where 3,000 limestone peaks rise from the emerald waters. We cruise among this amazing karst scenery, stopping to kayak (weather permitting) in places inaccessible by the larger boat, before a seafood lunch. In the late afternoon, we watch the sunset and enjoy another lovely meal before a night on the boat in twin-share cabins. Accommodation: Overnight boat

We continue to cruise around Ha Long Bay this morning before returning to port. We then drive back to Hanoi, and transfer to the airport for a flight to Da Nang (approximately 1hr 30min). Upon arrival, we take a transfer (approximately 45 minutes) and check into our hotel in Hoi An and relax. Accommodation: Hoi An Sincerity Hotel & Spa (or similar)

After breakfast, we enjoy a walking tour of Hoi An old town; a World Heritage site and the original European trading port in Vietnam. It is now a living museum, with attractive wooden merchant houses and pagoda-style temples with Chinese, Japanese, Vietnamese and European architectural influences. The afternoon is free for you to discover this marvellous place and enjoy the thriving riverside market. In the evening, we join an informal cooking class where adults and children will learn how to make some Hoi An speciality dishes and even create spring rolls. Accommodation: Hoi An Sincerity Hotel & Spa (or similar)

This morning, we jump on bikes for a ride on quiet roads through the countryside past markets, schools and villages before continuing to Cua Dai beach (3mi/5km). Please note, we can provide bikes for children who are 3ft 9.5in (1.2m) and taller. The afternoon is dedicated to free time at the beach for swimming, or you can take an optional boat trip on the river or relax back in town. Later this evening, we transfer (approximately 45 minutes) to Da Nang train station, where we board an overnight train to Nha Trang. The group will have use of day rooms at our Hoi An hotel until 6pm, which can be used to freshen up before the overnight train. Accommodation: Overnight train

This morning, upon arrival in Nha Trang, we have breakfast and then transfer (approximately three hours) to the tropical retreat of Whale Island. With just one guesthouse on the island and beach bungalow accommodation, this really is a chance to unwind in paradise. Accommodation: Whale Island Resort (or similar)

Relax and unwind today. Join a boat trip in the morning for a spot of snorkelling and sea swimming before a seafood lunch. During our boat trip, we pass a small fishing village and see the Whale temple on a small island (only local people are allowed access to this island). In the afternoon, you have the option to relax on the beach or walk around the island to the viewpoint for a 360-degree view of the mountainous coastline and the surrounding coves and white-sand beaches. Accommodation: Whale Island Resort (or similar)

We may have time for one last sea swim (depending on flight schedules) before transferring to the airport for our flight to Ho Chi Minh City, previously known as Saigon. This is an exciting and absorbing metropolis, where scooters rule the streets and old temples stand alongside modern developments. Accommodation: Huong Sen Hotel (or similar)
