Your accommodation represents the pinnacle of luxury residence within Vietnam, and your classy suite is elevated with a spacious balcony that will allow you to admire the panoramic views. After you have had some time to acclimatize to your surroundings, you will transfer to the stunning pagodas for which Vietnam is renowned. Giac Lam Pagoda is the oldest temple in the city, and its peaceful gardens, where a sacred Bodhi tree stands, will invite you to explore its intricate construction that is shrouded in Taoist and Confucianist philosophies. Your tour will culminate at Cao Dai Temple, which is an exemplary display of Caodaism and a community that believes all religions should be valued equally. The highlight of your visit will be witnessing the Caodaist people, who will be adorned in various colored robes and pray within the ornately decorated temple that features dragon-shaped pillars and a sky blue ceiling. Your first day in Vietnam will conclude with an elegant river cruise on a regal boat, where you will delight in a gourmet, multiple-course meal as you reminisce on your captivating discoveries thus far

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City – Trace Back Vietnam’s Past
dayInfo.description: Ho Chi Minh City is a destination that is imbued with iconic highlights that represent Vietnam’s turbulent past, both the dramatic disasters and gripping victories that occurred during the Vietnam War. This iconic period of history and, more specifically, the reunification of the country post-war will reveal itself to you as you journey with an experienced guide to the admired monuments and museums that are situated within the city’s diverse districts. Restored military vehicles, such as Huey helicopters and M48 Patton tanks, stand on display outside the War Remnants Museum while a collection of black and white stills hang on its interior walls. The trials and tribulations will have never felt as real as they will when you peruse the fascinating exhibits and are completely absorbed by the intriguing wartime stories. Afterward, you will find yourselves crossing underneath the royal palm trees that envelope the 1960s-designed government building, which is known as the Reunification Palace. Its abandoned halls, which you will wander, evoke a hair-raising atmosphere that perfectly encapsulates the feelings that were experienced by officials in 1975 when Communist tanks rolled up onto the gardens. Though steeped in history, its antiquated decor creates an eye-catching display of decades-old Vietnamese architectural design by which to remember your expedition. Finally, you will tour Ho Chi Minh City’s History Museum for a more dated look into its heritage. What was once a French-colonial country house is now a museum that houses ancient artifacts and relics that date back to the Bronze Age. You will be astounded to explore its treasure trove of gems before you make your way to a delicious restaurant for dinner.

dayInfo.title: Can Tho – Luxuriate on the Waterfront
dayInfo.description: Can Tho is a spirited city within the Mekong Delta and is situated on the banks of the Hau River. It features an exuberant waterfront and is flanked by a number of bewitching markets that will showcase Vietnamese authenticity in an unbridled fashion. During your stay, you will grow accustomed to the city’s vibrant groove as you meander along palm tree-lined boulevards and traverse narrow back streets to discover what makes this internationally sought-after destination tick. For complete comfort, you will enjoy your time here at a distinguished resort that will be with outstanding amenities and set on its very own islet for supreme privacy away from the hustle and bustle. You can spend the morning at your leisure before you transfer to Ninh Kieu Wharf, which is a thriving hotspot that features an ensemble of engrossing experiences. You can step out into nature and enjoy the serene settings at a quiet park before making your way to a premier restaurant for delightful Vietnamese dishes. You will be spoiled for choice over a collection of tantalizing meals, and each will highlight the celebrated chef’s finesse for crafting exquisite renditions of timeless classics. With an uninterrupted view of the river as your backdrop, you may snap up gorgeous images of the golden sunshine as it glimmers off of the water at sunset.

dayInfo.title: Can Tho – Tour the City Surrounds by Sampan Boat
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will board a private boat at the wharf and head for the Cai Rang floating market. Your voyage will transfer you across the river for approximately 30 minutes and provide you with a magnificent vantage point from which to view the city. Others will likely be doing the same as mornings in Vietnam begin with a bang, so you will float to the soundtrack of whistles and chatter, which will make your trip all the more immersive. Shortly after, you will reach the market and be in utter awe at its inception. Wooden vessels will be packed into a spacious corner of the river and present a variety of items for sale. Your boat will come into arms reach of the vendors, and you may exchange money for goods without having to leave your vessel. In a peculiar way, the chaos is orderly, and the locals have seemed to figure out a system that adapts on the fly to suit your travel needs, bringing you right into the thick of traditional Vietnamese living. After a thorough exploration, you will continue along and veer off the vast river to the tapering canals that flowing through rural villages. Your experienced guide will show you to the mangroves and the age-old stilt houses that are nestled within. You will feel greatly humbled as you witness a simpler way of life in which locals make do with welcoming smiles. You can explore more of the endearing, natural scenery and picturesque riverside settings as you continue to My Khanh Tourist Village. Priding itself in eco-tourism, your afternoon will be as inspiring as it is entertaining. You can visit preserved, ancient houses along tree-shaded streets and enjoy delicious delicacies as you are surrounded by the luscious wilderness before returning to your resort for a tranquil night's rest.

dayInfo.title: Phu Quoc – Surreal Seaside Settings off Vietnam
dayInfo.description: Though Vietnam is well-known for its staggering mountain ranges in the Northern regions, South Vietnam boasts beautiful coasts with brochure-worthy beaches. Off the Southern tip of Cambodia, in the Gulf of Thailand, lies the Vietnamese island of Phu Quoc. You will transfer to Phu Quoc from Can Tho and arrive at the sights of soft, white-sand shores that stretch out across the island’s coastline. The island boasts world-class, seaside resorts, and you will reside in an award-winning suite that affords unobstructed vistas of the expanse of azure water. A short walk out of your suite will find yourself on the pearly sands of Vung Bau Beach. Here, you can retreat to the shade of a nearby palm tree and watch the world go by in absolute comfort or wade in the warm water and feel all stress slip off out to sea. In the evening, you will transfer to a revered beach bar for some of the finest cocktails on the island. Tonight, you will be provided with a fine dining experience that you would expect from the likes of a Michelin-starred restaurant. A backdrop of the sunset over the sea will set the sky ablaze and share many surreal photo-worthy moments to commemorate your evening of relaxation.

dayInfo.title: Phu Quoc – Broaden Your Culinary Horizons
dayInfo.description: Today, you will discover more about the wondrous flavors of Vietnamese cuisine at a recognized culinary school on the island. Expert chefs will assist you in recreating cherished, traditional dishes, and you will discover Vietnamese cooking secrets to aid in your craft. The island naturally provides a spectacular setting in which to cook, and quality equipment and an expert chef will ensure that you experience the best training possible. After you have completed your course, you will delight in the fruits of your labor while you converse with your head chef to find out more about the country’s culinary culture. Afterward, you will transfer to more of the island’s marvelous beaches for a day to soak up the sunshine. You can laze on loungers with an elegant cocktail in hand and be embraced by the serenity of it all. Your brief stay in Phu Quoc will refuel your minds and bodies for the final leg of your enthralling expedition, especially after you have enjoyed a deluxe spa treatment at a leading wellness center, where aromatic oils will awaken your senses, and professional masseuses will knead away your knots.

dayInfo.title: Da Lat – Astonishing Spectacles of Sacred Art
dayInfo.description: Da Lat is a scenic retreat in Vietnam as its trademark natural wonders include impressive lakes, pristine flower gardens, and emerald forests that are teeming with wildlife. You will experience it all from your luxurious, French-colonial style hotel, which embodies 1920s charm in its stately suites and decorous furnishings. The Bao Dai Summer Palace was constructed in 1933 and is a regal display of the destination’s affluent influence, and you will capture images of the ornate belongings and iconic furniture that it houses. The elaborate architecture of Linh Phuoc Pagoda will provide further awe-inspiring spectacles to snap up in abundance as you encounter its colorful halls and storied murals, which serve as memoirs to Buddha’s life. Finally, you will witness the adored pieces of art within Zen Buddhist monk Vien Thuc’s sacred gallery in Lam Ty Ni Pagoda. The austere artwork embodies spiritual philosophies and depicts mysteries that are rooted in the local monks’ traditions in a manner that can rarely be seen anywhere else, giving you an entirely unique look into the talent of these humble painters.

dayInfo.title: Da Lat – A City of Unrestrained Natural Wonderment
dayInfo.description: The surrounding landscape features an array of pounding waterfalls and lakes, which offer dreamlike encounters with nature that you will revel in on your second morning in Da Lat. You will arrive at Datanla Waterfalls and be met by a momentous stream of silver water as you peer out from the small, wooden walkway bridge that connects the rocky paths. The trails, which wind around the waterfall, will become enveloped by a cool mist as the streams gush over the craggy rocks and you make your way to the translucent pools of water at the base of the falls. The Lake of Sighs, which awaits your arrival, is a body of water that is shrouded in the local legend of star-crossed lovers who would meet on its banks, but sadly, never ended up together. Though the stories are somber, the lake is stunning, and you will be whisked away across its beautiful banks in a horse-drawn carriage. As you approach the water, you may board a paddle boat and gently glide out into the lake’s center. With only the melody of bird song around you and a refreshing breeze that blows against your cheeks, you will feel absolutely detached from everyday life. Your afternoon will culminate at the Da Lat Flower Gardens, where immaculate, brightly-colored flower displays will guide you through the greenery, and the sweet fragrances of these blossoming flowers will fill you with vigor.

dayInfo.title: Cam Ranh – Transfer to the Vietnamese Maldives
dayInfo.description: Today, you will escape to a premium beachfront resort in Cam Ranh. Your ultra-chic suite embodies the luxury of the world’s finest seaside hotels, and the first-class amenities will ensure that your stay is utterly riveting. You can unpack your belongings and meet your private transfer who will lead you to what is often referred to as the Vietnamese Maldives of Binh Lap. With immense stretches of emerald sea to swim in and in addition to pristine beaches to relax on, you will cherish your day in the secluded splendor of this beloved island. The breathtaking landscape and calm atmosphere will make for an unforgettable afternoon under the radiant sun, and you can bask in the evening sunset at an award-winning beachside restaurant back in Cam Ranh for an exceptional taste of the finest Vietnamese seafood before falling asleep to the gentle, crashing of waves against the shore.

dayInfo.title: Cam Ranh – The Unspoiled Beaches of Nui Chua
dayInfo.description: Your final day in Vietnam will reveal the age-old beauty of Cam Ranh’s ancient coral reefs and untouched beaches of Nui Chua National Park. You will capture marvelous images of the picturesque rock and luminescent, moss-covered stone formations that encapsulate Hang Rai beach within the park. Before you return to your resort and gather your things, you will have the opportunity to visit Hang Rai’s grape arbor, where you can have a hand at picking grapes that burst with flavor and are used to produce local red wine. This uniquely Vietnamese experience will conclude your engrossing tour across its Southern highlights and fill your memories with magical moments of your adventures. You will comfortably transfer to Ho Chi Minh City before the afternoon sets in. You will make your way home feeling totally satisfied and wanting to return.

tourName: 11-Day Discovery in Northern Vietnam: Cities, Cruises, and Countryside
placesVisited: Hanoi, Ninh Binh, Ha Long Bay, Sapa
generalInfo: Discover the best of northern Vietnam on this 11-day trip, guiding you through the capital city, taking you across sparkling seas, and bringing you to rolling emerald hills. Featuring tours of Hanoi’s Old Quarter, trips to ethnic Hmong villages, and adventures to famous Ha Long Bay islands, this discovery shows off the best of the cities, cruises, and countryside.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Welcome to the Capital City
dayInfo.description: From the French Quarter’s old-world charm to the landscaped lawns surrounding Hoan Kiem Lake, your arrival in Hanoi, Vietnam, opens the doors to exploration in the heart of the capital city. Meeting your private transfer at Noi Bai International Airport, you continue to your accommodation in the historic old town, with views of the lake’s sparkling waters and lush gardens. The evening is free for you to settle in at your accommodation and wander at your leisure, discovering Hanoi’s secrets among the famous hustle and bustle.

dayInfo.title: Ninh Binh - Discover Tam Coc’s Caves by Boat
dayInfo.description: Hanoi is just around the corner from the rolling forest mountains and wide emerald waterways of Ninh Binh, where your adventures in the Vietnam countryside begin. After privately transferring to your Ninh Binh accommodation, you will join your specialist guide for a Tam Coc boat excursion along the Ngo Dong River. Golden rice fields dominate the banks of the channels, limestone mountains tower on either side of you, and three iconic natural caves await your discovery as you trade your transfer boat for a paddle boat and glide in and out of the staggering cliff-face caverns.

dayInfo.title: Ninh Binh - Freely Explore the Red River Delta
dayInfo.description: The Red River Delta circling Ninh Binh city is a treasure trove of adventure activities and cultural experiences for you to relish at your pace today. With your day open to the possibilities in Ninh Binh, you can fill your itinerary with plans that speak to your preferences. You may go gallivanting around the city to taste northern Vietnamese delicacies like oc luoc xa , lemongrass and chili pepper-cooked snails, or cross Bich Dong Pagoda’s stone bridge to explore the spiritual jungle grotto. The day is yours to enjoy on a whim and there are endless highlights across the delta.

dayInfo.title: Ha Long Bay - Set Sail Across a Garden of Islands
dayInfo.description: Your private driver will meet you after breakfast and you will transfer to Ha Long City to board a luxury cruise liner. The boat, bound for the dramatic karst islands of Ha Long Bay, is fitted with first-class amenities and is a glamorous way to explore Vietnam’s famous garden of islands. As you arrive near the Dark and Light Caves’ entrances, you can prep your bamboo boat or kayak for a paddle in and around the dramatic hollows puncturing the cliffs. In the evening, enjoy a cooking demonstration and wind down in style with dinner and spectacular sunset views.

dayInfo.title: Ha Long Bay - Relax on Islands Across the Bay
dayInfo.description: There are few better ways to wake up in Ha Long Bay than with tai chi on the sundeck, appreciating the sweeping island panoramas during the morning glow. Your boat continues on its course, weaving around the towering karst islands towards the historic Viet Hai fishing village. You can explore the floating homes and step foot on Cat Ba Island, choosing to cycle through the prolific rainforest or kayak around the sea caves. Before evening, you arrive at Ba Trai Dao islet, where you can wallow in the water, sunbathe on the sun-kissed beach, or sip cocktails on the deck.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - One Last Stop and Return to the Mainland
dayInfo.description: Before arriving in mainland Vietnam, you can wake up with the sunrise, watch the golden light pierce the clouds, and see the sky turn from pitch black to orange, then blue as light floods the islands. Returning to Ha Long City, one more stop at Ao Ech is a perfect way to round off your luxurious cruise by kayaking against the backdrop of the bay’s iconic karst formations. After you arrive at Ha Long pier, your private transfer takes you to Hanoi, where you can enjoy the comfort of your accommodation or the excitement of exploring the city at night.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Tour the Culinary and Cultural Highlights
dayInfo.description: From sunrise to sunset, Hanoi is a city alive with activity. While your accommodation is a refuge from its busy neighborhoods, you will wake up eager to discover what makes the capital tick. Cho Hom Market is the first stop on your city tour and Vietnam’s famous egg coffee, ca phe trung , is a must-try to kick off your day the traditional way. You will then walk the Old Quarter, following your nose to stalls serving bun cha , Vietnamese meatballs, and nem cuon , Vietnamese spring rolls, while listening to your guide share Hanoi’s historical stories.

dayInfo.title: Sapa - Journey to the Rolling Northern Hills
dayInfo.description: Tuck into a traditional Vietnamese breakfast of banh mi , Vietnamese baguette sandwiches, or pho , Vietnamese rice-noodle soup, before a long but comfortable drive to the rolling northern hills of Sapa. You will cross the northern countryside, viewing the ocean of lush mountains that rise and fall like waves from your window. Approaching Sapa, you will gaze across rice terraces that cascade the mountain slopes, where modest farming practices support ethnic villages across the region. Between the hills, your charming accommodation awaits, with bungalows overlooking the countryside.

dayInfo.title: Sapa - Learn About Vietnam’s Hmong Heritage
dayInfo.description: Today, you will acquaint yourself with Sapa’s humble and peaceful local life as you join your guide at the Bac Ha Market. Colorful lanes of traditional textiles invite you to peruse the ethnic garments. Food stalls flood the market with fragrant aromas of northern delicacies like com lam , sticky rice cooked in bamboo shoots, and sour salmon hotpot. Your guide may introduce you to a Hmong villager, translating for you as you learn about the local way of life. This cultural introduction to northern Vietnam is a valuable and authentic educational experience.

dayInfo.title: Sapa - Walk Across Sapa’s Emerald Slopes
dayInfo.description: Today, you will familiarize yourself with the cultures of Sapa as you hike through the Muong Hoa Valley. From Muong Hoa Village, you and your guide walk through the countryside along trails that zigzag between the golden rice terraces to Lao Chai. Here, the grassy pathways become dirt trails and hill tribes nestle between paddies on the slopes or at the tops of hills for greater landscape views. You may join a Hmong family with your guide to delve deeper into their culture and traditions, returning with a greater appreciation of rural Vietnam.

dayInfo.title: Sapa - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: Your adventures will end today and you will leave having seen the best of northern Vietnam’s cities, seas, and countryside. After breakfast, you privately transfer back to Hanoi, where you arrive at the airport for your flight home. You will bid farewell to your driver and guide, leaving with beautiful memories of your cultural tours and dramatic discoveries from Ninh Binh to Ha Long Bay, Hanoi, and Sapa.

tourName: 14-Day Vietnam Tour: Northern Landscapes & Southern Cruising
placesVisited: Hanoi, Ha Giang, Sapa, Cat Cat, Hoang Su Phi, Phin Ho, Bac Ha, Y Linh Ho, La Cai
generalInfo: Discover a country brimming with rich culture, captivating natural beauty, and delectable cuisine when embarking on our 14-day northern landscapes and southern cruising Vietnam tour. Tread off the beaten path to eco-focused villages, drive winding roads up striking mountain passes, and dive into dish after dish of unforgettable local flavors. Compare the contrasting cultures of the north and south while uncovering some of Vietnam’s best-kept secrets.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Embrace the Bustle and Ambiance of Vietnam’s Capital
dayInfo.description: Welcome to Vietnam’s pulse, its capital and the UNESCO citadel of Hanoi. The city buzzes with modernity, while embracing tradition through golden pagodas and ancient temples. After transferring to your hotel and settling in, time is yours to explore. You may wish to stroll along the base of 120-year-old Long Bien Bridge, its soft gray arches coming to life with exquisite murals depicting tales of vendors displaying their wares. Return to the 11th century with a Hoan Kiem Lake water-puppet show. Watch puppeteers in waist-deep water guide wooden characters in expressive movements, accompanied by the whistle of bamboo flutes or the cry of a Vietnamese opera singer.

dayInfo.title: Ha Giang - Discover Vietnam’s Final Frontier and Picturesque Hoang Su Phi
dayInfo.description: Travel to the far north of Vietnam to the province of Ha Giang. The country’s final frontier will greet you with narrow, snaking roads that creep up through green, cone-shaped hills and jagged rocky highlands that seem to tumble down into lush forested valleys and the picturesque terraced rice fields of Hoang Su Phi. Walking through the wavering sea of gold, you may pick up the fresh, hay-like aroma filling the air. Absorb the quiet hum and beautiful stillness of your rural surroundings, accompanied by broad smiles and welcoming gestures. Embrace the simplistic and eco-friendly environment of your overnight destination, your accommodation of bamboo and bricks with solar-powered energy lighting up your stay.

dayInfo.title: Phin Ho - Discover the Rich Traditions and Culture of the Red Dzao Tribe
dayInfo.description: Making your way on foot through scenic valleys of light and dark greens flanked by golden terraced rice fields and distant, dark mountains, arrive in the charming village of Nam Hong. As the morning clouds lift, look out over crops, breathing in the refreshing country air. Meet the Red Dzao community, one of Vietnam’s largest minority ethnic groups. Greeted by a quiet hello and broad smile, bold red headdresses compliment long, navy robes as you are handed a cup of bronze. The deliciously sweet and fruity Shan Tea, a precious commodity that’s native to the region, will warm you as you step inside a traditional thatched Dzao home, oval in shape, with a humble portico over a welcoming door.

dayInfo.title: Pan Hou Village - Trek Downhill Through Bamboo Forests and Lush Valleys
dayInfo.description: Gently ease your way into today, enjoying a light lunch before embarking on your trek to Pan Hou Village. Weave your way through a thin wall of bamboo forest, the rustle of leaves gently swaying in a light breeze as you come upon a trickling stream. You may stand in awe as you gaze out over the rippling landscape of terraced rice fields, swirls of crops covering undulating hills and highlighted in brilliant greens and gold. Later, unwind as you embrace the calm of your surroundings, perhaps taking a dip in the warm waters of a herbal bath or enjoying a massage.

dayInfo.title: Bac Ha - Witness Daily Farm Life Then Cruise On The Chay River
dayInfo.description: Driving to the enchanting and peaceful town of Bac Ha today, your journey transports you into a world of immense scenic beauty, the land rich with apple farms and green tea plantations, valleys of rice fields and a lively ethnic market where vendors present colorful handicrafts and livestock create a cacophony of sounds. If visiting in the springtime, you may experience the beauty of pink and white plum blossoms as you wander around the Ban Pho village. Continue your scenic exploration with a lazy cruise on the snaking Chay River, its waters flanked by sheer, slate rock faces and a lush river bank.

dayInfo.title: Sapa - Wander Morning Markets and Walk Around Rice Paddy Terraces
dayInfo.description: Heading up to Vietnam’s highest peak, Mt. Fansipan, your journey today sees you traversing mountainside roads hugging steep slopes and undulating hills. Captivating scenery surrounds you under a smoky sky and cotton clouds. The views are vast and simply breathtaking as the tower-shaped peak leers above the tranquil landscape. Wind your way down to the Cat Cat village, stopping at the impressive hydroelectric station. Watch as ribbons of water flow from dramatic waterfalls onto giant bamboo and wood water wheels. Enjoy a riverside lunch before embracing the charm of the small mountainside market town of Sapa in the Muong Hoa Valley.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Hike Dirt Trails and Embrace Local Culture and Color
dayInfo.description: A combination of driving, hiking, and a lot of learning is on the cards today as you take a journey along dusty dirt trails, over breathtaking mountain passes, and through fruit fields, rice paddies, and farmland. Your destination is Hanoi and the adventure in getting there introduces you to a world of culture and color in the landscape and local tribes. Meet the Black Hmong people who live in the Ta Phin village, immediately impressive in their colorful and immensely detailed garb. Their clothing is intricate in design, with indigo-dyed hemp used to create jackets, sashes, skirts, and leg coverings with geometric designs, using stitching and applique to express identity and tradition. No two designs are ever the same.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Explore Hanoi by Motorbike and Savor Traditional Street Food
dayInfo.description: Explore more of Hanoi’s charm, culture, and outstanding street food during today’s adventure, conducted from the back of a motorbike. Visit the iconic Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, the dark gray cube-shaped monument made of marble that stands as a tribute to Vietnam’s former president, fondly referred to as “Uncle Ho”. There is a sense of stillness and calm inside the silent, sacred space. Later, explore the street food scene of the Old Quarter as you dive into bowls of traditional pho , with its rich, salty flavors of beef and smooth texture of noodle soup, or bite into a green papaya salad, enjoying the juicy, crunchy textures and fresh taste of this colorful dish.

dayInfo.title: Ha Long Bay - Soak Up the Emerald Water Wonderland of Ha Long Bay
dayInfo.description: Trade gravel roads for emerald waters today as you embark on your voyage through Ha Long Bay. Guests onboard the wooden “junk” are immediately met with a warm greeting to complement the breathtaking scenes that unfold around them. Limestone pillars of varying shapes rise from below the waters, lush coverings of jungle-like vegetation contrasting the water. Cruise through the lesser-populated Bai Tu Long Bay, an exquisite seascape often referred to as “Heaven on Earth”. Your adventure culminates in the unique experience of dinner inside the Drum Cave. Rocky ceilings are magically transformed into a fairy-lit haven, dining tables filled with classic Vietnamese flavors of lemongrass, garlic, and spice, offering an inviting aroma and taste.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City - Enjoy Tai Chi and Visit a Floating Fishing Village
dayInfo.description: Start your morning with a Tai Chi class, rekindling the relationship between body, mind, and breath, then step onto a sampan , a traditional Vietnamese boat. Low to the water and simple in design, these vessels are long and slightly turned up at the end, making them ideal for fishing. Glide gently along the waters of the small and uncluttered Bai Tu Long Bay observing vendors and fishermen selling their wares and honing their craft in the Vung Vieng floating fishing village. Absorb the cackle of a lady drawing attention to her pottery display and the laughter of fishermen bragging about their catch of the day. Find your land legs again as you bid Hanoi farewell and head to Ho Chi Minh City.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City - Discover Contrasting Cu Chi and Ho Chi Minh Cities
dayInfo.description: Pick up the speed today with a fast boat ride to the underground city in the Cu Chi Tunnel, a labyrinth of corridors and living spaces. Arched passage walls are smooth, narrow, and dimly lit, the air cool and still, the cave seemingly soundproof. Head to Ho Chi Minh City, which bursts with mopeds, monuments, and mighty skyscrapers. Visit lively Ben Thanh Market, the lingering scent of sweet fragrances filling the air as you wander through rows of colorful clothing and souvenirs while the aroma of grilled seafood draws you to the food stalls. Bite into soft and chewy banh beo , rice cakes with toppings such as scallions and shrimp.

dayInfo.title: Tra On - Learn the Tricks of the Coconut Oil and Brickworks Trade
dayInfo.description: Visit the town of Ben Tre in the Mekong Delta, your first adventure of the day being a mango cruise, a chance to experience untraveled parts of the famous delta as you wind your way along quiet canals en route to new discoveries. Step ashore to visit a coconut processing factory and watch and learn as slicing, dicing, and crushing techniques turn the fruit into sweet candy or oils. Observe the nutty and tropical aroma of the coconut before visiting a traditional brick-making site in Vung Liem. Traveling on bicycles, pull up to a production line of workers feeding burnt clay bricks into traditional kilns. Continue to your luxury accommodation in Tra On for the evening.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City - Experience Floating Markets and a Wave of Trading Vessels
dayInfo.description: Tra On floating market is a sea of organized chaos, a myriad small boats laden with fresh fruit and produce, their handlers all vying for business as their floating stores bring variety and quantity to all who visit. Spend some time here before moving on to the famous Cai Rang floating market. Watch as vendors juggle fruit, throwing the precious produce from boat to boat and floating over gentle waves while balancing a pole of hanging mangosteen and grapefruit, durian and coconut candy. Boats gather, chatter fills the air, and the vibe is pulsating. Enjoy your time on the water before returning to Ho Chi Minh City.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City - Take One Last Wander Around Historical Ho Chi Minh City
dayInfo.description: Depending on what time your onward journey begins, you may have time to explore a little more of bustling Ho Chi Minh City. Perhaps a visit to some of the historical sites, such as Reunification Hall, said to be a historical monument that contains the essence of eastern culture, or the beautiful Cathedral of Notre Dame. Bid farewell to Vietnam as you transfer to the airport.

tourName: Amazing Southeast Asia Tour: Cambodia, Vietnam, and Laos
placesVisited: Phnom Penh, Siem Reap, Saigon, Mekong Delta, Hoi An, Hue, Hanoi, Halong Bay, Luang Prabang
generalInfo: The ancient history and culture of Southeast Asia is yours to explore on this specially designed tour through Cambodia, Vietnam, and Laos. From the magnificent Angkor temple complex to the extensive paddy fields of the Mekong Delta, the elegant temples of Luang Prabang to the powerful walls of the imperial city of Hue, you will find the unforgettable combination of ancient architecture and modern culture, enticing cuisine and unparalleled countryside. The allure of Southeast Asia is in its past, present, and future.

dayInfo.title: Phnom Penh – A Sitting Pearl
dayInfo.description: Welcome to Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia and a place once called the Pearl of Asia. The Mekong River is alive with fishermen. They cast their nets out in long strides in search of their daily catch. A wide, charming avenue rushes alongside the riverbank. The city holds keys to the country’s contemporary and ancient history. Independence Monument stands like a tower in the city center and was constructed in the late 1950s. The tower rises over 60 feet tall and is modeled after the country’s best-known monument, Angkor Wat. When night begins to sweep across the city the fountain is lit with blue, red, and white floodlights. Settle into the luxury of the Raffles Le Royal Landmark Hotel, a stunning display of Khmer, Art Deco, and French Colonial architecture.

dayInfo.title: Phnom Penh – The Khmer Trend
dayInfo.description: The luscious scent of fresh coffee and buttery pastries, aromas reminiscent of a French Colonial past, brings you wide-awake. The city streets come to life in the early morning. Fishermen quickly venture out onto the water. After breakfast your guide meets you at your hotel. You step out onto the boulevard and find the frangipani shimmering in the early light. The National Museum of Arts contains the largest cultural collection in the country. Some of the artifacts date as far back as the fourth century. The museum was constructed in a traditional Khmer style using red sandstone that creates a rich red hue against the backdrop of the clear blue sky. There are over 14,000 artifacts in the museum’s care, including a bronze statue of a reclining Vishnu. When you step into the courtyard you will find four lotus pools. The garden is a virtual outdoor exhibition filled with bas-reliefs and stone work that date between the 6th and 11th centuries. Your tour through the history of Phnom Penh continues and the tremendous images of the country’s empirical grandeur will follow you.

dayInfo.title: Siem Reap – The Majesty of Temples
dayInfo.description: The collected images of Cambodia’s history are vibrant in your mind and will soon come to life. Your private transfer meets you at your hotel and escorts you to Siem Reap, the city known as the “Gateway to Angkor.” Settle into the lavish lodgings of the Raffles Grand Angkor Landmark. The elegant accommodation is situated near the Old French Quarter and is just a short distance away from the Angkor complex. Soon you will come to the treasured history of Angkor Wat. The afternoon sun casts a golden hue over the sandstone. A forceful bridge connects the mainland to the courtyard. You venture through the entrance gate and feel like you have stepped back in time. Angkor Wat is the best preserved example of Khmer architecture in the country. It is easy to look upon the magnificent scale of the structure and have your breath taken away. The famous temple was constructed in the 12th century as a symbol of the king’s connection to Vishnu. The central tower stands taller than the four that surround it. Enter into the second gallery and find a continuous relief. The images tell the story of the Mahabharata epic.

dayInfo.title: Siem Reap – The Connected Complex
dayInfo.description: The morning bursts with energy. The city comes alive with the aromas of fresh coffee and delicious pastries; one scent is enticingly rich and the other is hypnotically sweet. Your guide meets you at your hotel and escorts you back to the Angkor complex, this time taking you to the grand city of Angkor Thom. The entire complex is over a mile long and surrounded by five gigantic gates that stand 60 feet tall. The gates themselves are worth the visit. You notice the stone elephant trunks running along the walls. Bayon Temple is the most famous sanctuary in the complex. It was built in the 12th century and blends Buddhist and Hindu imagery. It is located at the center of the walled city and is meant to represent the intersection of heaven and earth. The stupas are not just stone towers but also contain the enigmatic smiling faces of a single enlightened being.

dayInfo.title: Siem Reap – The Embodied Lake
dayInfo.description: Today you will step away from the Angkor temples and make your way to the mythological shores of Tonle Sap, the largest freshwater lake in Southeast Asia. Climb aboard a traditional sampan and venture into the lake’s center. During the wet season the water’s edges expand dramatically. The surrounding grasslands are lush and fertile. In the dry season the water contracts to an equally dramatic measure. At the center of the lake you find a village that stands above the water’s surface. Each home is built on stilts that allows for the intermediate rise and fall of the lake throughout the seasons. The local villagers are friendly and gracious. You can see a number of sampans winding through the water. Some boats look to carry fishermen while other boats ferry children to and from shore. The soft breeze brings a cool and refreshing draft across the water.

dayInfo.title: Saigon – The Size of Saigon
dayInfo.description: The five towers of Angkor Wat are visible in the distance as you soar through the sky and arrive in Vietnam’s largest city, Saigon. The neighborhoods are vivacious and endlessly energetic. You can easily be swept up in the whirlwind of modern comforts that fill the city. The culture and traditions of the locals persist in the shadows of the spreading skyline. You find the luscious scent of garlic and fresh made rice noodles. The decadent flavors of pho lure you into many delicious restaurants that hide around every corner. Spend the day exploring the exhilarating neighborhoods or enjoy some time relaxing in the comforts of the Caravelle Hotel Deluxe. The luxurious space is located in the heart of the city and is imbedded in the stretch of French colonial architecture that lines the wide and elegant avenues.

dayInfo.title: Saigon – The Spirited Streets
dayInfo.description: The architecture in downtown Saigon is not the only mark the French left on the city. You awaken to the aroma of rich Vietnamese coffee. Sip the slightly bitter and fabulously rich cup before you visit the city’s sites on a walking tour. The Central Post Office is an example of elegance. The famous architect Gustav Eiffel designed the building in the late 19th century. The neoclassical architecture takes you out of Southeast Asia and onto the streets of Paris. The long, arched entryway reflects the light and highlights the sepia maps that drape the walls. If it wasn’t for the large painting of Ho Chi Minh that hangs at the far end of the building you might forget that you were in Vietnam all together.

dayInfo.title: Saigon – The Culture of the River
dayInfo.description: Outside of Saigon the Mekong Delta rushes along the southwestern edges of the countryside. The river stretches from the Tibetan Plateau down to the South China Sea. Your guide escorts you to the riverbanks and you board a boat to discover the sensational culture of the waterway’s endless canals. Over the riverbanks the landscape is awash with paddy fields as far as the eye can see. Farmers stand knee deep in water and pick at the budding grains. Local fish farms are nestled against the sides of the river. They look similar to the homes on Tonle Sap that stand high on stilts. Come to Turtle Island where you will board a small sampan and traverse the immense snaking canals. Large palms dangle overhead. The warm afternoon light reflects off of the water. The shallow sampans maneuver easily through the river’s depths. Tall grass blocks your view of the surrounding farms. In the afternoon you will come to Cao Dai Temple to meet the colorful people involved in the creative synthesis of world religions.

dayInfo.title: Hoi An – Small Town Charm
dayInfo.description: Today you will depart from the energetic whirl of Saigon and make your way to the charismatic town of Hoi An located in central Vietnam. The city was once the center for Vietnam’s vibrant trade of silk and cinnamon in the 15h to the 19th centuries. The narrow lanes are lined with cheerful paper lanterns. The Japanese Bridge was built in the 18th century and continues to act as an iconic image of the city’s past and present. A Taoist temple is located on the bridge’s north side and continues to be used as a place of worship. The spiced scent of sandalwood emanates from the burning incense. A pair of monkeys and a pair of dogs guard the bridge’s entrances. Stand on the bridge and watch the Thu Bon River flow gently beneath you. In the soft glow of the paper lanterns you can settle into the Life Resort Hoi An Junior Suite River View Hotel. The trickle of the river adds to the city’s charm and helps calm the day’s rush.

dayInfo.title: Hoi An – The Flavors of Town
dayInfo.description: Experience the city like a local by tasting the unique flavors of Hoi An on a tour of Central Vietnam’s popular cuisine. Your private guide meets you at your hotel ready to take you through the city’s diverse tastes. You come to the local market and are immediately enticed by the herbaceous scent of coriander and mint. Garlic and chili add a spice to the aroma. Follow your guide through the zigzagging alleyways of the local market where luscious produce lines the walkways. Fresh seafood that was caught that morning is displayed in a different area of the market. You sit down at a local stall and watch the chef dice carrots and onions. You are trying the city’s quintessential dish of Cao Lau. The noodles fill the bowl and are topped with shrimp. The components of the dish are layered and delicious. Each added flavor gives you a deeper understanding of the food, the culture of Hoi An, and the connective elements of Vietnam.

dayInfo.title: Hue – Passing to the Imperial
dayInfo.description: Wake up to the relaxing sounds of the river. After breakfast your private transfer meets you at your hotel and is ready to escort you to the imperial city of Hue. You leave Hoi An behind and imagine the distant flicker of the dangling paper lanterns. Your drive takes you over the magnificent Hai Van Pass and through the stunning mountains. The pasture shines emerald in the high mountains that rise up to 1,620 feet. The South China Sea brushes against the base of the range. It catches the sunlight and looks sapphire. Arrive in Hue and come to the beautiful La Residence Hue Deluxe River View. The tropical greenery outside of your luxurious room adds to the hotel’s elegant atmosphere.

dayInfo.title: Hue – Where the Emperors Stay
dayInfo.description: The city is inundated with ancient grandeur and superb artistry that dates back to the 19th century. After breakfast your guide meets you at your hotel. Fortified walls wrap one and a half miles around the grounds to protect the ancient citadel. Each wall is over six feet thick. The Imperial Enclosure is where what was once the emperor’s residence stands. It sits at the center of the citadel surrounded by stone walls 12 feet high. The atmosphere is both reminiscent of a gloried past and steeped in the remains of the Vietnam War. Out of 148 buildings that once graced the center of the bastion only 20 remain. The temples and shrines that do remain offer a glimpse of the elegant architecture that is found within the imposing stronghold.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – The Modern Luxuries of Hanoi
dayInfo.description: The imperial splendor of Hue has persisted for centuries and continues to captivate locals and visitors with its impressive construction. Today you will say goodbye to the inspiring citadel and graceful temples and make your way to Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam. The city is filled with modern energetic neighborhoods while also maintaining a connection to its traditions. Hoan Kiem Lake is an example of the strong connection that the city has to its culture. The body of water is steeped in ancient legend which is displayed in temples and monuments around the complex. The city’s bustle seems to disappear behind the quiet lush trees that surround the lake. The water ripples in the soft breeze and you notice couples strolling along the pathways. They stand atop the bright red wood of Huc Bridge and watch the large soft-shell turtles swim past. In the evening you can get comfortable in your lavish room at the Sofitel Legend Metropole Hotel.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – The Past in the Present
dayInfo.description: The aroma of fresh Vietnamese coffee is enthralling. It seems to lift through the streets. You can see the locals adding condensed milk to the cups and turning the rich dark color to cream. The French architecture stands behind the tree-lined boulevards. The leaves add a brush of greenery to the buildings’ tawny hues. The Temple of Literature is situated near Hoan Kiem Lake. It houses the oldest university in the country which dates back to the 11th century. The temple is dedicated to Confucius and contains a statue of the teacher atop a small altar. The scent of sandalwood fills the gallery. The red and gold painted robes stand out against the sanctuary’s wooden frame. When you walk through the first courtyard you will come to the Dai Trung Gate, known as the Great Middle Gate, edged by smaller entryways. It is your first step into the ancient history and treasured culture that continues to connect the city to its rich past in order to move the country forward.

dayInfo.title: Ha Long Bay – A Night on the Bay
dayInfo.description: This morning you find yourself on the banks of the world-renowned Ha Long Bay. The early mist is subtle and cool. It soon dissipates and is replaced by the rising sun. The sunrise brings a depth of orange that fades to pink and finally disappears into the bright blue sky. You can see the water glowing a faded emerald in the early light. Climb aboard your traditional Chinese junk and venture out onto the bay. The Jasmine Cruise is a spectacular wooden ship that will have you sailing through the majesty of Ha Long Bay in complete luxury. The Limestone islets are famous around the world and number up to 1,600. You can’t miss the incredible karsts that protrude from the water. Some of the limestone is covered with lush greenery; other times you can see the dark gray boulders peeking into the sky. The collection of karsts that rise out of the water look like dragon’s teeth and gave way to the legend of the bay. Later you will come to Tien Ong Cave. The cave’s mouth is 150 feet wide and over 42 feet tall. Step into the grotto and find a domed ceiling that drips with stalactites. The colors of the limestone shift in the light from blue to gold and back again. It adds to the unparalleled natural luster of the day.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – The Flavors of the Bay
dayInfo.description: The morning stretches over the bay and makes the karsts glint in the light. In the early daylight hours you can enjoy the view of the bay from the ship’s deck while partaking in a Tai Chi demonstration. Each movement is slow and controlled to help sooth the body and the mind. You can also enjoy a cooking demonstration and indulge in the flavors of the sea. You watch the chef choose the ingredients carefully. Each carrot and coriander leaf is inspected. The shrimp was freshly caught this morning. The aromas of garlic and ginger are enticing. Soon you find the crispy and delicious flavors of a hand made spring roll in front of you. The water continues to shine a tremendous color of gemstone. The tide ebbs and flows against the islands’ rocky outcrops. In the afternoon you return to shore and have a private transfer back to Hanoi.

dayInfo.title: Luang Prabang – Into the Ancients
dayInfo.description: The morning passes you by as you make your way from Hanoi to Luang Prabang. The city is considered to be the best representation of ancient Southeast Asian architecture. There is inherent charm in the streets that stem from the 33 temples spread throughout the city, along with the exceptional greenery that makes the urban expanse feel like a rural town. Wat Wisunarat is Luang Prabang’s oldest temple and dates back to the 16th century. Its stupa is uniquely shaped and designed to resemble a lotus flower. The temple’s interior contains a small selection of ancient stones and gilded Buddha statues. The surrounding trees are calm and the courtyard is serene. The temple is still in use, which accounts for the low hum that sometimes emanates from the main gallery. In the evening you will find comfort in the lushness of La Residence Phou Vao with a junior suite that looks out to the extraordinary mountains.

dayInfo.title: Luang Prabang – The Allure of Water Falling
dayInfo.description: The city is surrounded by mountains, which make the sun rise just a little bit more before it casts its light over the expanse of temples and trees. South of the city is the celebrated Kuang Si Waterfall. The water pools at the top of the three tiers and eventually leads to the main cascade of over 200 feet. You follow the trail that takes you beneath the lush emerald canopy. You can hear the falls before you see them. The sound of trundling water is never far away. The river is an elegant turquoise that reminds you of a jewel. On the smaller tiers you can see the water drape over the rocks like beaded curtains. The mist rises into the air and has a cooling effect under the canopy. You can see locals jumping off of the rocks and into the lower pools. The laughter is contagious and the images are unforgettable.

dayInfo.title: Luang Prabang – Over the River
dayInfo.description: The Mekong River begins in the Tibetan Plateau and rushes down to the delta that leads into the South China Sea off the coast of Vietnam. After breakfast you are taken to the riverbanks where you will step aboard a long-tail boat. Your skipper stands at the helm, located at the back of the boat, and leads you to the mystical Pak Ou Caves. The mountains are overrun with tremendous jungle and brush against the riverbanks. Local fishermen float down stream in search of their daily catch. Local homes are built on stilts to account for the water’s sporadic undulations. The caves rise over 50 feet above the river and are carved deep into the cliff. The lower cave is known as Tham Ting. The interior is filled with over 200 images of Buddha and made of mostly carved wood. Once inside the cave you feel the cool draft that comes when the earthen walls are hidden from the sun. The images have been collected and placed, cared for and regarded. It is like nothing you have ever seen before. Look out over the river and see Buddha’s innumerable silhouettes blending into the fabulous artistic landscape of Laos.

dayInfo.title: Luang Prabang – Departure
dayInfo.description: Sip on the unique flavors of the coffee and taste the accompanied buttery and sweet croissants once more. The simple flavors of the French Colonial days continue to delight the locals and you have come to relish them as well. In the mist you can hear the morning procession of the monks. The sienna robes glow in the early light. People offer alms of rice and cookies. The monks hum in a low and hypnotic tone. Soon your private transfer will meet you and escort you to the airport for your flight home. But for now you can enjoy the daily routine of the city, its people, and the colorful world of Southeast Asia just a little longer. Zicasso offers many options for Vietnam vacations . For additional ideas and traveler experiences, read the Vietnam tours reviews .

tourName: Amazing Vietnam Vacation: Karst Islands to Imperial Citadels
placesVisited: Hanoi, Ha Long Bay, Hue, Hoi An, Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon), Mekong Delta
generalInfo: Escape to Vietnam on a spellbinding tailor-made tour that allows you to visit much of this breathtaking destination in 8 days. From the bustling cityscape of Hanoi to the emerald water of Ha Long Bay and its picturesque islands, this journey through Vietnam brings you closer than ever to its captivating culture and spectacular scenes.

dayInfo.title: Ha Long Bay - A Garden of Karst Islands
dayInfo.description: The oriental charm of Vietnam will dazzle you as you touch down in Hanoi, the country’s bustling capital. Scenes of roadside stalls riddled with sizzling woks and decorated pagodas dressed in gold will dominate the views from your transfer. Your transfer will take the form of a private driver, who will convey you to the pier for an overnight cruise across Ha Long Bay. Dramatic karst islands pepper the emerald bay, and you will swoon over sea spectacles during your voyage to modest fishing villages, such as Cua Van Floating Village and Tien Ong Cave. Colorful marine creatures reside inside the cave.

dayInfo.title: Hue - Cruising to a Surprise Cave
dayInfo.description: The sunshine will flood your ship's deck in the morning and dance off the bay’s emerald water, a flawless setting to accompany a vitalizing Tai Chi class should you wish to partake. You will then savor a sumptuous Vietnamese breakfast on board while the boat slowly glides toward Surprise Cave, a bewitching cavern that boasts impressive stalactites and stalagmites. In the afternoon, you will transfer to Hue for a colorful few nights in the former Imperial seat of Vietnam.

dayInfo.title: Hue - Imperial Citadels and Humble Villages
dayInfo.description: The evocative cityscape of Hue retains its old-world charm. Serving as the residence of the Nguyen Dynasty, the empirical glory days are most notably visible among the ruins and remnants of Dai Noi Citadel but still echo through the atmospheric alleys and charming town squares of the city. You will peruse the magnificent architecture that composes the citadel's skyline before gallivanting to spirited villages where Vietnam’s trademark humility shines brightest. During a visit to Bao La Village, you will be welcomed by the friendly locals before indulging in a truly authentic Vietnamese dinner prepared by chef Mrs. Nhu Huy in her home.

dayInfo.title: Hoi An - Along the Hai Van Pass
dayInfo.description: You will begin your expedition to southern Vietnam along the staggering Hai Van Pass. The winding roads pass jagged rocky outcrops that tower toward the clouds and panoramic viewpoints that showcase golden Vietnamese rice paddies. Hai Van Pass is a tour in itself that will lead you to the charming Old Quarter of Hoi An. Here, structures steeped in memories and pagodas drenched in history are just a few moments in the town that will evoke stirring emotions.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City - Swept Up in the City
dayInfo.description: This morning, you can bask in the radiant sun that illuminates Hoi An’s pristine beach. Later today, you will transfer to the booming city of Ho Chi Minh City. After arriving in Ho Chi Minh City, you will be blown away by the buzzing energy that floods the cityscape, which is reminiscent of a true Southeast Asian skyline. You can join the crowds and visit significant heritage sites, including the Reunification Palace and Notre Dame Cathedral. Here, the country’s dramatic past may unravel itself. As you make your way to the iconic opera house later, you can scour the streets for authentic culinary treats on the back of a Vespa, which is a quintessential Vietnamese experience you cannot miss.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City - Along the Mekong
dayInfo.description: Today, you will venture from the bustling cityscape to discover the breathtaking beauty that lies beyond its towering skyscrapers. On a traditional wooden sampan boat, you will float along the Mekong Delta to floating markets and revered temples. The chocolate-colored river is flanked by lush foliage, and singing birds can be heard fluttering through the trees. You will stop at cultural landmarks, such as the Cao Dai Temple, Ancient Mandarin House, and Binh Hoa Phuoc en route to see emblazoned statues, fruit orchards, and ancient nurseries.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Explore to Your Heart's Content
dayInfo.description: The sun may crack through the clouds of Ho Chi Minh City and filter onto the streets this morning. Some streets are often swamped by early risers either heading to work or doing the culinary rounds. You will transfer back to Hanoi shortly after breakfast to experience the country’s exuberant energy. Whether you find yourself people-watching under the shady trees along the Hoan Kiem Lake, venturing to nearby villages, or cheering at a water puppet show that spotlights Vietnam’s unique cultural performances, you can take pleasure in your final moments in this jubilant part of the world.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Final Flavors in Vietnam
dayInfo.description: This morning, you may rise to the sounds of a city overflowing with life. The crackle and sizzle of coals burning under grills, the warm chatter of friends in a foreign language, and the buzzing of grounding coffee beans may cause you to reminisce about the amazing memories you have created on your trip. You can seize your last morning in Vietnam with a hearty traditional breakfast at a beloved street food joint before wrapping up your vacation by heading to the airport by way of private transfer.

placesVisited: Hanoi, Duong Lam, Bai Tu Long Bay, Ninh Binh, Tam Coc, Hoa Lu, Sapa
generalInfo: The Vietnamese landscape is picturesque and is no better showcased than in Northern Vietnam. Amid the surreal settings are the country’s most significant highlights. On this tailor-made tour of Northern Vietnam, you will explore the best experiences within the region. From ornate spiritual sites to the immaculate images across Bai Tu Long Bay and to the emerald rice paddies of Sapa, we have handpicked a wealth of extraordinary adventures. You will learn about ancient traditions, visit pivotal sightseeing destinations, delve into delectable Vietnamese cuisine, and embark on a lavish sea cruise as you encounter some of the best aspects and attractions of Northern Vietnam.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – A City Bursting with Energy
dayInfo.description: Northern Vietnam is bursting with life, and there is no better destination to begin your adventure than the vibrant city of Hanoi. Hanoi is teeming with riveting, cultural experiences, and you will explore them from your opulent base in the city, which will be an exquisite hotel with a panoramic view of the Red River and Hoan Kiem Lake. The gorgeous views are only half of the charm of this lavish accommodation. You can enjoy seclusion within your private suite and delight in world-class amenities throughout your stay. A professionally-run gourmet restaurant sits on top of the hotel, serving exceptional cuisine alongside sweeping cityscape views. The city bustles in the morning, and you will wake to the exuberant energy that resonates from the lively streets below. Wafts of traditional cuisine will fill your senses, guiding you out of your hotel in search of delectable delicacies. Stop off at a high-spirited market and peruse the endless stream of stalls. Amid eager locals and foreigners, you will discover the endearing flavors of authentic Vietnamese cuisine and will explore more of the rich cultural highlights of Hanoi as you transfer to the famous Old Quarter. Here, you can stroll the streets that are lined with French-colonial architecture and colorful shops that sell unique souvenirs. You will fully immerse yourselves in the local lifestyle as you discover the enthusiastic nature of Old Quarter, Hanoi. The zestful location delivers on all expectations, capturing your attention on every corner. In the evening, you will visit a premier restaurant for intricate meals that are prepared by an award-winning chef. Set amongst traditionally-inspired decor, you will thoroughly enjoy the luxury of this authentic experience. While the city retains an element of traditional charm, it is best experienced beyond its borders. Accompanied by a knowledgeable tour guide the following day, you will set off in a private coach to Duong Lam Ancient Village. Being a UNESCO-awarded location, the peaceful age-old city shares enchanting architectural displays, cultural complexes, and scenic sights. Positioned off of the beaten track, you will delight in the calm and laid-back ambiance as you encounter cultural sites and capture unforgettable images of the mostly untouched surroundings as you cruise along the winding roads. You will witness old water wells, century-old residential buildings, and ancient banyan trees along the way. You will also experience a traditional tea ceremony that will be conducted by a friendly local for complete immersion. Then, you will transfer to Hanoi later this afternoon for an evening at your leisure, and you can conclude your stay with a delightful dinner at a revered restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Bai Tu Long Bay – Remarkable Cruise Across an Idyllic Bay
dayInfo.description: Just a short trip from Hanoi lies the stretching waters of Bai Tu Long Bay, which is a collection of untouched limestone islands that are covered in emerald foliage. You will transfer via luxury vehicle to the pier in the morning. From here, you will board a regal cruise liner that is bound for the natural beauty of the bay. You will spend three days and two nights exploring the pristine islands that are dotted around the crystal waters of the bay from the comfort of this lavish cruise liner. Your journey will kick off in full swing with welcome drinks and a delicious lunch spread. Charter the bay and witness remarkable vistas from the open-air deck, and revel in complete relaxation as you unwind in fashionable style. Your spacious room highlighted with its Vietnamese design, exquisite décor, and first-class amenities will keep you thoroughly enthused. The afternoon will bring with it surreal views of the karst mountains, and you will soon arrive at a premier kayaking location, where you will be whisked away as you enjoy an isolated kayak cruise along the calm bay. Breathe in the fresh air, soak up the sun as you encounter the natural beauty of the surrounding environment, swim in the warm Bai Tu Long Bay water, and capture memories together that will last a lifetime. You will return to the liner after a thorough exploration of your surroundings and indulge in an expert spa treatment that will be performed by professional staff on board the boat, and you can spend the rest of your afternoon lounging around the pool and enjoying the scenic views. Your evening will culminate with an elegant dinner and delectable cocktails, and you will continue your captivating journey the following day at a traditional floating fishing village. Here, you will connect with the friendly locals and brave a beautifully rugged cave. You will be treated to a BBQ lunch on a secluded beach for the perfect midday break. Kayaking and swimming in the vast bay water will share further vistas of the riveting environment. You can bask in seclusion within the comfort of the cruise liner and conclude your expedition with gourmet meals that are accompanied by an unforgettable sunset view. You will disembark the boat on the following day, however, your journey will not end here. You will transfer to a nearby agricultural village shortly after the liner has docked and familiarize yourselves with the culture and tradition of this peaceful village as you meet the welcoming locals. You will be completely immersed in their way of life as you encounter traditional performances by artists of the village, and your luxury sea voyage will share valuable insight and leave you feeling rejuvenated.

dayInfo.title: Ninh Binh – A Taste of Traditional Vietnam
dayInfo.description: Away from the hustle and bustle of Hanoi lies a peaceful city that lines the Red River: Ninh Binh. The diverse landscape that is complete with meandering rivers, karst mountains, and immense rice paddies, will be a sight to behold. Furthermore, there is a wealth of cultural discoveries for you to uncover as you explore the highlights of this less-traveled gem. You will transfer within a well-kept, comfortable vehicle to a gorgeous, boutique resort that will be located amid the luscious greenery. A selection of renowned, international wines can be found at the resort’s wine bar, and you may enjoy a refreshing treatment at the top-tier spa. Your stay will leave nothing for you to desire as you luxuriate in stylish seclusion from the over-visited tourist hubs. The surrounding Ninh Binh area is full of character. There is a rustic simplicity and laid-back ambiance that will seem to emanate from the picturesque landscape on which the city was founded. Dotted around the city are beloved cultural landmarks that you will explore on your first full day. You will encounter the majesty of Bai Dinh Pagoda, which is a sacred, spiritual complex that perfectly captures old, architectural charm. The surreal site is home to gorgeous Buddhist images that are set amid endearing wildlife. The sprawling complex is nestled below a striking mountain, and the natural views will fill you with great admiration for Vietnam’s environment. Your journey will continue to the world-famous Mua Caves, where you will witness the most enchanting vistas of North Vietnam from the heights of the mountain’s viewpoints. You can capture images of cascading rice paddies and rolling green hills that encompass the unspoiled environment. Explore more of the districts that surround Ninh Binh the following two days as you travel to Tam Coc and Hoa Lu. Tam Coc is a mesmerizing rural destination that has been made famous by the Oscar-winning movie Indochine . Though visitors find their ways here more frequently, there is still an atmosphere of untamed beauty within the location. Dirt roads on which locals traverse via bicycle are surrounded by towering karst mountains, fascinating caves and grottos are in abundance across the rugged region, rice paddies stretch far into the distance, and you will find yourselves flying through memory cards as you capture incredible, scenic shots. A trip to the ancient city of Hoa Lu will reveal intriguing monuments and artifacts. You can encounter distinguished temples and grand pagodas that were built centuries ago, and as you are accompanied by a private tour guide, you will learn a great deal more about Vietnam’s engrossing past.

dayInfo.title: Sapa – The Immaculate Sights of Sapa
dayInfo.description: Your final destination highlight on this Northern Vietnam tour is Sapa, which is a mountainside town that is near the country’s northern border. Said to be one of the most beautiful locations in Vietnam, Sapa is not a city that can be omitted on a vacation through Vietnam, especially Northern Vietnam. You will leave on the evening of your tenth day onboard a luxurious train from Hanoi. Your trip will be spent in complete luxury as you settle into a comfortable private cabin with professional staff that ensures that all your needs are met. Vietnamese style and decor will be highlighted on this regal railway journey, and you will witness the sprawling countryside along the way. Vistas of the greenery and limestone cliffs will provide an enthralling backdrop for your idyllic images. You will disembark your cozy cabin early in the morning and comfortably transfer to a local cafe for breakfast, where you will indulge in a deliciously prepared Vietnamese breakfast among the natural splendor of this mountainous region. You will feel worlds away amid the secluded beauty before making your way to your chic resort and checking into your luxury suite with sweeping mountain views. Spend the afternoon at your leisure, basking in a reviving spa treatment with ancient Vietnamese wellness practices. The flourishing town boasts wildlife hikes to postcard-worthy lookout points. You can spend your day venturing to these picturesque views as you traverse the forest settings. You will capture images of the rugged cliff faces and cascading rice paddies that sweep down into the emerald valleys. Untamed wildlife will circle the paths, and you will hear the whistle of birds as they soar overhead. In the afternoon, you can visit an ethnic market and peruse the exuberant stalls that sell local trinkets and gems. Locals dressed in colorful garments will make you feel completely welcomed as you connect with the traditional lifestyle and explore the authentic culture at an inspiring museum, where you will witness relics of the past and learn about the northern post’s dramatic heritage. Your evening will be spent in style as you fine dine with panoramic countryside views of the towering mountains. Today, you will journey to more of the destinations wilderness highlights. Amid the untamed jungles lie pounding waterfalls and bamboo plantations. Traverse the environment in search of these gorgeous locations and immerse yourselves in nature along the way. Your tour will culminate with a trip to a local ethnic hill tribe. Accompanied by a private tour guide, you will have the opportunity to meet the people who call this serene destination home. Share a meal with a friendly family and listen to stories about their fascinating past. You will witness traditional performances and discover what makes their lifestyle so unique. There is a humble ambiance that exudes from this destination you will rarely find anywhere else. Make your way, in the comfort of the same luxury train, back to Hanoi for one last evening and day in the vibrant city.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – Fine Dining in the Capital
dayInfo.description: You will arrive at your stellar hotel in the heart of Hanoi for your final evening in Northern Vietnam. Check into your lavish suite and head out for a fine dining experience that will be worth bragging about once you return home. You will meet an award-winning chef and share in tantalizing meals throughout the evening. The coveted, multiple-course meal will take you on a flavor journey as you discover the unique tastes of authentic Vietnamese dishes. The evening will culminate with elegant cocktails and sunset vistas atop a leading rooftop bar in the city.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – Authentic Vietnamese Cuisine and Departure
dayInfo.description: You will further delve into the rich flavor profile of Vietnamese cuisine on your final day in this magnificent country. Early in the morning, you will transfer to a prestigious culinary school, where you will be accompanied by professional chefs who will select essential ingredients for you at a local market. You will return to the school where you will begin preparing a selection of endearing dishes. With the help of your expert chef, you will learn the intricate details behind these unique meals and bring out the exceptional flavor in your own creations. You will share your meals to bring the experience to an end and delight in the fruits of your labor. A certificate will be awarded to you to showcase your newfound culinary skills, and you will bid your farewells and meet your private transfer. Finally, you will transfer to the airport with exceptional memories and lifelong images of this diverse expedition through Northern Vietnam. You will soar into the sky, ebullient with the exciting adventures that you have had. Until next time, Northern Vietnam will eagerly await your return.

tourName: Best of Vietnam Tour: Amazing Ha Long Bay to Labyrinth Cu Chi Tunnels
placesVisited: Hanoi, Ha Long Bay, Imperial City of Hue, Ho Chi Minh City
generalInfo: Your time in Vietnam can be spent experiencing the variety of cultures and lifestyles that have evolved throughout the history of the country. On this custom tailored tour you will find the beauty of Ha Long Bay’s natural landscape within the impressive limestone karsts, and experience the brimming historical culture in Hanoi. From the remarkable jovial sounds of the Cai Be Floating Market to the distinctive calls of the morning Cao Dai prayer, your time in Vietnam is sure to bring you the quintessence of the people as well as the majesty of the surrounding landscape.

dayInfo.title: The Sounds of Hanoi
dayInfo.description: Welcome to the eclectic city of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam. You are met at the airport by your private transfer and taken to your luxurious accommodations located within the center of the city. The variance of the city is felt within its streets. The sound of bustling motorbikes brings a sense of the modern world to the traditional neighborhoods where the whir of bicycles and jovial conversation in small restaurants is also heard. In the evening you will delight in your first taste of Vietnam at a charming restaurant within a French Colonial building before arriving at the famous Water Puppet Theater. The traditional entertainment stems from the 11th century paddy fields which flooded during the monsoon season. You watch the history and mythology of the countryside come to life over a series of stories that dance on the water’s surface with intense interest from the players and the crowd alike.

dayInfo.title: Following the Character
dayInfo.description: The remarkable history of Hanoi dates back a millennium, which you can almost feel in the palpable energy that runs through the city. Today you will be met by your guide and taken on a private tour through the city’s skyscrapers and to a glistening lake, highlighting the past that has created Hanoi’s particularly mesmerizing present. The Temple of Literature pays homage to Confucius and is home to the first university in Vietnam, dating back to the 11th century. The temple complex is a tremendous preservation of traditional Vietnamese architecture and is filled with a wealth of literature, pavilions, courtyards, and passageways once reserved for royalty. In the northern courtyard you can see the low hanging pagoda housing a scarlet-robed Confucius statue surrounded by the spicy scent of burning incense.

dayInfo.title: The Many Karsts of Nature
dayInfo.description: Enjoy the flavors of breakfast accentuated by the rich scent of fresh Vietnamese coffee. Afterwards you will be whisked away to the shores of Ha Long Bay to step aboard a traditional Chinese Junk. The wooden-style ship has sails that span out with the texture of unfolded paper fans. It is impossible not to notice the water sparkling like emerald in the afternoon sun. Limestone karsts rise out of the water like protectorates of impressive height and stature. The breeze is cool on your cheeks and brushes over the South China Sea. Over 1,600 islands create the archipelago that is filled with sensational beaches and unparalleled caves. When the boat docks for a moment you have the opportunity to step into Surprise Cave on Bo Hon Island. Considered to be the most captivating cave on the islands, the name originates from the overwhelming beauty that comes along with stepping inside the main grotto. The colors shift from the filtering sunlight within the cool air that sweeps through the earth. The walls are smooth on your fingers while you follow the path through stalactites and stalagmites to the deepest grotto known as the Royal Garden. A clear pond sites at the bottom of the open space and looks as though it contains a fascinating collection of mountains. The scent of Benjamin figs overtakes the stone and the majesty of nature continues.

dayInfo.title: Roaming the Bay
dayInfo.description: The salty and sweet scent of the sea drifts over the boat in the early hours of the day. You continue to careen through marvelous karsts that seem more impressive in the morning light than they did the previous day. The quiet atmosphere that surrounds the islands and the water adds to the unforgettable moments found within the landscape. Soon the scent of fresh Vietnamese coffee once again fills the air and you can delight in the dark roast accompanied by the sweet, buttery, flaky French pastries, remnants of the French Colonial past. In the afternoon you will be met on the shores of Ha Long Bay and taken back to Hanoi with the remainder of the day at your leisure. In the evening you can experience a taste of Hanoi’s Old Quarter and the flavors of a restaurant that has been operating for over 100 years at Cha Ca La Vong. Ca cha , the celebrated fish for which the restaurant is named, is grilled at your table and served with the scents of turmeric and dill hinting at the taste of the fabulous meal to come.

dayInfo.title: Present Capital to Past Capital
dayInfo.description: The morning is yours to stroll along the walkways beside Hoan Kiem Lake or linger in the cafes situated within the French Colonial architecture of Ba Dinh Square. In the afternoon you will make your flight to Hue, the classic imperial city in central Vietnam. You will be collected upon your arrival at the airport, and soon settled into your comfortable accommodation, and then taken out to experience the first part of the history that brims over with wonder. A large number of the current population of the city resides within the citadel. Walls that are over six-feet thick spanning over six-miles wrap around the entire area, encircled by a moat. Here you will find what remains of the elegant former city dating back to the 19th century. The energy is both resigned and exciting. The courtyard at the center of the complex once held the Forbidden Purple City which was accessible only to royalty, but was destroyed during the Tet Offensive in the 1960s. However, the citadel remains impressive, displaying the essence of the city’s and the country’s past within the large stone walls and impressive moat, where the Nine Holy Cannons still act as protectorates of the palace and the kingdom.

dayInfo.title: More than Regal Walls
dayInfo.description: Today you will tour the tomb of Emperor Khai Dinh, where minarets are shaped like stupas and symbolize the stability and splendor of the old dynasty. In the Honor Courtyard you can view the sculptures of Mandarin soldiers, elephants, and horses standing proud before the Stele Pavilion. The strong stone and tremendous detail which overtakes the entire complex, including the tripartite staircase, creates an ethereal ambiance within the site. In the evening you will have an intimate dinner at one of the city’s famous garden houses, known for their illustrious dynastic past. Each house is constructed of traditional timber and feature brick roofs, the entirety of which is surrounded by manicured gardens. The calm rustle of greenery strewn along the lily pond fills the soothing quiet of the early night. The scent of coriander and chili begins to overtake the floral aromas of the garden, and you taste the essential passionate and historic flavors of Hue.

dayInfo.title: A Higher Pass and Further Past
dayInfo.description: The day begins with a delicate breakfast which highlights the energizing taste and aroma of Vietnamese coffee. Soon you will venture outside of Hue and find yourself on the Hai Van Pass, one of the most fabulous roadways in the country. The jade of the lush trees and grass rises and falls along the landscape of the mountains, sloping downward towards the South China Sea, and brings the emerald land to the edge of the sapphire water. You will arrive in Danang in time for a tour of the Cham Museum. The Champa Empire dates back to the 2nd century evolving from its Indian roots. The museum houses over 300 terracotta and stone works that have been found all over the country and date back as far as the 7th century.
