Your knowledgeable tour guide will chaperone you across the royal rice fields and along the sloping mountains to Xa Linh Village, which is an endearing town where a Hmong hill tribe resides. Rural and secluded, this rarely visited village gushes with authentic character and evokes pleasant feelings of times before businesses boomed. Its allure is distinguished in all directions, and as you peruse the dirt roads, you will catch glimpses of natives dressed in traditional embroidered skirts and traders who sell unique Vietnamese curios. A local family will welcome you to their home, and you will be accompanied by your bilingual guide and deeply experience their fascinating heritage and timeless traditions. A few members of the community will appear in colorful clothing and provide entertainment in the form of a customary Hmong performance in celebration of your visit. Your tour will culminate with a sumptuous spread of Vietnamese specialty dishes in which you will be delighted. Your meal will be complete with the pronounced flavors of this gorgeous and unique region. Before you retreat to your resort for some rest, you will cycle across the sprawling roads which line the edges of emerald rice paddies and jade mountains. You and your family will capture unforgettable moments together as you cruise within this oasis of natural splendor and snap photos within the idyllic hues of the Vietnamese countryside.

dayInfo.title: Sapa – Entrancing Treks across the Tonkinese Alps
dayInfo.description: Perhaps one of the most appealing aspects of traveling in Vietnam is the incredibly diverse and unfrequented mountainous regions that lie further in the North near the Laos and Chinese borders. Here, there is little in terms of tourism, and the delight stems from precisely this. The crowds wean off of the roads, and the faces of foreigners fade behind the lively towns that brim with locals. There is a simple atmosphere that blankets Sapa, flowing from the peak of its tallest limestone cliffs. The untamed splendor of Sapa will be explored from the utmost comfort of your reputable suite within a first-class resort that is nestled below the Tonkinese Alps. You will journey to this prestigious accommodation on board a regal train in your own secluded cabin, which will showcase passionate vistas of Northern Vietnam. Sapa is an essential trekking destination, and this is due to the fact that it boasts the country’s most entrancing environments. Your knowledgeable tour guide will lead the way as you hike across the stepped rice terraces that descend toward gentle river streams in the valleys. All the while, mysterious caves in the Karst Mountains will loom over you in glorious fashion, and an adventure through them will bring you closer than ever to Vietnam’s natural terrain. Your landscape expedition will culminate in the clouds as you venture forth to a premier restaurant that is perched on the top of a hill. The cool climate will invigorate you, and stylish refreshments will be served to your table as your jaws drop to the sights of the rolling escarpments. You will further witness the surreal settings as you delight in a fine dining experience at a signature restaurant that specializes in Hmong cuisine. Here, you can indulge in an assortment of delectable dishes at the celebrated restaurant and delight in the distinct zest of local corn and rice wine. Famous for its pounding waterfalls of tremendous natural beauty, a trip to Sapa would be incomplete without a thorough family adventure to the most sought-after waterfalls. The Silver Waterfalls tower from the ground, and their winsome streams are steeped in legendary tales that trace back many years. You will discover more of this folklore as your tour guide leads you to the renowned Love Waterfall, where the ancient stories will untangle themselves before your eyes. Sapa Lake is the final waterscape that you will encounter during your riveting stay in the region. You and your family will glide across the peaceful, glassy face of the water and be surrounded by architectural gems and mountainous prospects before reflecting on the thrilling experiences in which you will have indulged.

dayInfo.title: Bai Tu Long Bay – Explore a Waterscape of Grand Natural Design
dayInfo.description: Ha Long Bay, which is situated off the Northeastern coastline of Vietnam, is a pivotal highlight that features a sprawling, emerald waterscape where limestone islands ascend out from the water’s surface. Bai Tu Long Bay is characterized by the same magnificent prospects, however, it is off the beaten path, and a regal sea cruise will take you across Ha Long to Bai Tu Long’s concealed landscape. The memorable cruise will showcase the stunning vistas while offering you and your family a fancy escape from the bustle of the busy cities. On board, you will be treated to sublime Vietnamese cuisine and an endless array of activities that are designed to maximize your family-fun. Your sea voyage will bring you to pearly, white-sand beaches on limestone islands, where you may spend the day, lounging under the toasty sun or in the water among the sparkling sea life. You and your family will be given the opportunity to kayak across the tranquil waters and capture images of the rugged rock formations in all their flawless grandeur. Enduring caves will encourage you to witness the destination’s hidden enchantment as you brave the dark rock tunnels, which will amaze you with their untouched, natural structures. Your tour will continue to a long-established agricultural village that oozes rural authenticity. Shrouded in timeless traditions and significant cultural customs, you and your family will discover the local farmland lifestyle and learn about its role in the economic prospects of Vietnam. A luxurious spa treatment awaits you and your family on board the boat, and as professional masseuses knead away any and all of your tension, you will all feel completely revitalized before returning to the Vietnamese shores. A morning Tai Chi demonstration will give you more time to focus on yourselves and vivify your minds and bodies.

dayInfo.title: Hoi An – A Distinct Destination of Diverse Cultural Influence
dayInfo.description: Hoi An is located in the Northern half of central Vietnam against the stretching coastline of the East Vietnam Sea. It is a charming city of marvelous, tropical appeal that is home to a prosperous history that you will have the luxury to uncover. Your home away from home will be a 5-star resort that features a collection of extraordinarily sleek villas and world-class amenities that will keep you all thoroughly enthused. Hoi An attained its zenith of influence through the 17th and 19th centuries, where Japanese and Chinese cultures helped to shape the distinctly diverse traditions that underpin its current conventions. The town is packed with noteworthy landmarks, and these will be best explored by foot as your tour guide escorts you through the illustrious districts. The Assembly Hall of the Chaozhou Chinese Congregation offers a glimpse of the ethereal decor and architecture for which its country is known. You will feel as though your family has been spirited away to a forgotten world as you stroll through the unique landmark. Afterward, the quaint Japanese Covered Bridge, in all its ancient glory, will take your breath away as you witness the elaborate wood carvings along the bridge, which serves as an important pedestrian passageway. Finally, you will fully immerse yourselves in the traditions at a Vietnamese Lantern making class. Trained experts will share stories of the lantern’s significance in their culture as well as demonstrate the time-tested process that is used to create these artisanal displays. You will depart Vietnam with a wealth of knowledge and insight into the country’s captivating traditions in addition to memories of the great family-friendly activities that you will have adored. Your journey will conclude with one last, exquisite Vietnamese breakfast before you transfer to the airport with plenty of time to spare and reminisce on your enchanting expedition to North Vietnam before flying home.

tourName: One-Week Tailored Tour of Vietnam’s Paramount Places
placesVisited: Hanoi, Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon), Ha Long Bay, Mekong Delta
generalInfo: Spectacular views and historical insight await you on this 7-day adventure through Vietnam. Escape the stresses of everyday life on this enthralling trip to one of Southeast Asia’s most beloved destinations. From the luxurious northern highlands to the Mekong Delta countryside, Vietnam is dynamic and diverse in both landscape and lifestyle. With an entire week of enriching experiences, you will dabble in all things Vietnam from its renowned spice-infused cuisine to its history that is commemorated by cherished museums and landmarks.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – Introduction to Vietnam
dayInfo.description: When you land, you will be transferred to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of Hanoi. Once you arrive, you can unpack your belongings, settle into your room, and begin to get accustomed to the local lifestyle that is typical of Southeast Asia. Shortly after you have arrived, you will meet your knowledgeable food guide in the lobby and set off for a complete taste immersion of Hanoi. You will feel like a celebrity being whisked to trendy functions as you slip through the traffic in a limousine to the most admired restaurants in Hanoi.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – Vietnam’s Countryside
dayInfo.description: Tribal villages that are nestled in the luscious lowlands and highlands beyond Hanoi city’s borders represent over 50 ethnic minority groups. Each one of these groups possesses a unique heritage. You will immerse yourselves in these cultures today. Your day’s escape from the city will begin with an ethnic hill tribe. Being equal parts informative and astonishing, you will delight in the opportunity to connect with the locals and gain a more in-depth understanding of their culture and heritage. You may also be encouraged to assist in the creation of these authentic dishes. After lunch, you will continue to the environmental wonders that are dotted across the terrain, beginning with the chambers of Mo Luong Cave.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – Hanoi’s Historical Roots
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will arrive at the foot of the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum. Many locals and visitors flock to it daily to pay their respects to the preserved body of their former leader, which is housed in a transparent glass case. You will continue your drive into the history of Vietnam at the Temple of Literature, which is an ancient construct that was originally designed as a university for Confucius' academics. You will conclude your tour at the Vietnamese Women’s Museum, which is an ode to the inspirational women of the country’s history and a hallmark of their incredible achievements. Your final evening in Hanoi will be yours to enjoy as you please.

dayInfo.title: Ha Long Bay – The Bay’s Breathtaking Seascape
dayInfo.description: Today, you will transfer to Ha Long Bay. The UNESCO World Heritage Site is famous all over the world, and therefore, will be a pivotal part of your tour. You will venture to many of the best destinations in Vietnam, and you will not be disappointed as you witness the enchanting, natural wonders from the repose of a spacious cruise liner. Your journey will lead you gently across the calm waters of the Gulf of Tonkin to reveal every detail of the staggering seascape as if it has been captured in a travel brochure. You can wallow in the peaceful serenity that envelopes your stunning joyride or unwind with a wellness therapy session at the liner’s tasteful spa.

dayInfo.title: Ha Long Bay – Visit Staggering Islands
dayInfo.description: This morning, you can invigorate yourselves with a fresh brew of premium coffee before you make your way to the sun-bathed deck for a Tai Chi session that will be led by a professional guide. The fresh sea breeze, morning air, and spectacular views will set an unprecedented tone for the day ahead. Today, you will step off of the cruise liner and dig your toes into the smooth sands of Ti Top Island, which is a tropical locale whose name was coined by Ho Chi Minh himself. Once you have gotten your fill of the view, you can make your way back down the mountain and board your boat, which will be bound for the awe-inspiring Trong Cave.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City – The Mekong Delta
dayInfo.description: Your luxurious liner will dock in the morning, and you will be whisked away to the airport to board your flight to Ho Chi Minh City. More popular than Hanoi, Ho Chi Minh City is a booming metropolis that is categorized by high-rise buildings and first-world technology. Serving as the gateway between the bustling city and the modest countryside, the Mekong Delta will lead you closer to the authenticity of Vietnam’s origins in a manner that you will adore. Shortly after, you will arrive at a quiet noodle shop where only a handful of other residents sit on wooden stools, slurping down hot bowls of broth. Your day on the delta will be respectfully completed with visits to the spiritual temples that are hidden among the forested landscape.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City – Departure
dayInfo.description: Today will be your final morning in Vietnam. With a few hours to spare, you can fill up on a continental breakfast and head to the lobby, where your guide will be waiting in a unique, three-wheeled mode of transport that is known as a cyclo . Your experienced tour guide will usher you around the city, weaving through the traffic and toward a few beloved Ho Chi Minh City highlights that are worth capturing before you leave. The tour will provide a pleasing conclusion to your luxurious adventure through Vietnam. Once your tour has finished, you will transfer to the airport for your international flight home.

tourName: Rich History of Vietnam in One Week: Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi, and Hue
placesVisited: Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon), Hue, Hanoi
generalInfo: Immerse yourself in the storied past of Vietnam with this historically focused 7-day Vietnam tour. Exclusively tour the country’s beloved destinations of Ho Chi Minh City, Hue, and Hanoi in addition to retracing the country’s past. From hallowed heritage sites to cultural landmarks, experience the cultural splendor of a historically rich country.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City – Vietnam’s Spirited Energy
dayInfo.description: When you arrive in Ho Chi Minh City, your guide will be waiting to greet and transfer you to your accommodation in the heart of the city. You will have the opportunity to settle in and relax before having the remainder of the evening to spend at your leisure. You can bask in the day’s fleeting sun or stroll through the streets for a quick immersion into the culture of the city. Regardless of how you choose to spend your evening, you will experience the unique energy of the city.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City – The Life of Ho Chi Minh
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, your guide will lead you on a heritage tour to some of Vietnam's most significant landmarks. Under the guidance of a local expert, you will set off to the sites of venerated temples and revered statues. Your first stop will be the Ho Chi Minh City Museum, which was constructed in 1885. You will have a few hours to explore the museum at length before transferring to the Reunification Palace. After touring the palace, you will continue to a collection of other noteworthy landmarks. After your tour, the remainder of the evening will be yours to spend at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City – Geological Wonders
dayInfo.description: On your final day in and around Ho Chi Minh City, you will be led to more of the city’s highlights, such as the Cu Chi Tunnels and the Mekong Delta. After breakfast this morning, you will meet your guide for an exclusive tour to each famed location. The drive will whisk you out of the cityscape to the bucolic countryside that is categorized by golden pastures and distant mountains. Your first stop will be the Cu Chi Tunnels, which feature an intricate web of underground corridors. Afterward, you will continue to the Mekong River and board a wooden sampan boat for a cruise through the canals. You will visit a rural river village and be welcomed by the locals.

dayInfo.title: Hue – Wondrous Scenes on Hai Van Pass
dayInfo.description: You will have an early morning so that you can fly to Hue. The city will immerse you in the riches of Vietnam’s shrouded history as well as the memorable moments of Ho Chi Minh’s life. After having some time to relax after your transfer, your guide will lead you on a tour of Hue, which will include Hai Van Pass. After touring for a couple of hours, your guide will lead you to a secluded beach, where you may spend the afternoon on pristine shores. Once the sun begins to dip below the horizon, your guide will return you to your accommodation for the evening.

dayInfo.title: Hue – An Ancient Empire
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, your guide will lead you on a tour to many of the city’s esteemed highlights, such as Dai Noi Citadel and the Ho Chi Minh Museum of Hue. The focus of today’s tour will be Ho Chi Minh, and each site offers a glimpse into his past and shares the essence of a life well-lived. During this tour, you will trace back years through the lenses of preserved cameras, age-old documents, handwritten books, archaic equipment, and much more.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – The Resting Place of Ho Chi Minh
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, you will transfer to Hanoi. This city is the final resting place of Ho Chi Minh. Upon your arrival, you will be greeted and transferred to your accommodation. When you are ready, you can partake in a tour of the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, which is an imposing building that serves as the resting place for the leader. Once your tour concludes, you will have the remainder of the evening to spend at your leisure. Your guide can also provide you with excellent dining recommendations.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – Departure
dayInfo.description: This morning will mark your last in Vietnam. You can rise early and make the most out of this final morning or relax in the comfort of your private room. After breakfast, you will transfer to the airport for your departure.

placesVisited: Ho Chi Minh City, Cu Chi Tunnels, Phu Quoc, An Thoi, Da Lat, Cam Ranh
generalInfo: Southern Vietnam leaves little to be desired on this enchanting couple’s tour to its most beloved destinations. You and your partner will discover the magical charm of a country that is steeped in fascinating culture and splendid scenery as you venture to the booming city of Ho Chi Minh, step onto the soft sands of Phu Quoc Island, and submerge yourselves in the picturesque countryside of Da Lat. With exquisite accommodations to retreat to and a divine cuisine to tuck into, you will be swept away by the majesty of this endearing, 10-day adventure through Southern Vietnam.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City – A Taste of Vietnam’s Finest Food
dayInfo.description: There are few places in Vietnam that exude the same kind of chaotic energy that Ho Chi Minh City or Saigon does. It is a cultural melting pot that draws in millions of travelers each year, and as a result, it booms with luxurious experiences that you will rarely discover anywhere else across Vietnam’s diverse topography. Its busy districts showcase the unrivaled allure of its imposing influence, where you and your partner will be completely enveloped by its cultural and heritage highlights. Your immersion will begin in the heart of Ho Chi Minh at a 5-star hotel, where you will acclimatize to the area as you soak up the marvelous atmosphere that resonates from the exuberant cityscape. Here, you will have a taste of exceptionally prepared Vietnamese cuisine as an array of first-class restaurants invite you into their fashionable spaces. Luxury is presented in every aspect of this fine dining experience, which you will enjoy on your first evening in Saigon. Delicate fragrances will waft through the restaurant as professional chefs’ work tirelessly to produce the award-winning fusion food that they are most famous for, and each mouthwatering bite will awaken your palate to the unique and distinct flavors that renowned food bloggers yearn to savor when visiting Vietnam.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City – Weave Your Way through the Cu Chi Tunnels
dayInfo.description: Though Ho Chi Minh’s premier restaurants serve immaculate meals, the revered chefs add a sophisticated flair to the traditionally-inspired dishes to cater to haute cuisine connoisseurs. For a more authentic taste of Vietnamese cuisine, you will transfer to a morning market that is brimming with charming character. Vendors set up shop early in the morning, and the market will be animated by breakfast time. Accompanied by a professional food guide, you and your partner will meander through the vivid aisles in search of beloved delicacies. Your tour will continue after you have indulged in many of the delicious snacks of Saigon. You will travel away from the bustling city and toward the celebrated Cu Chi Tunnels in the utmost comfort of a private speedboat. The Cu Chi Tunnels, which are steeped in significant history, served as a hiding place for Viet Cong soldiers during the country’s war with France and America. The elaborate network of tunnels is a delight to explore, however, their construction is as a result of a dramatic wartime past that will reveal itself as you wind your way through the web work and out the other side. You will dig deeper into Vietnam’s heritage than ever before as this iconic experience symbolizes the immovable spirit of the locals.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City – World-Class Displays of True Artistic Talent
dayInfo.description: Beyond food and history lies Vietnam’s enchanting arts and cultural scene, and you will set off to uncover what makes this scene shine shortly after breakfast. Remarkable galleries and exhibition houses that are dotted around the city will bring you closer than ever to the captivating culture that underpins the county’s thriving creative fields. The Museum of Fine Arts offers a glimpse into the talent that beams from the paintings that hang from its French-Chinese architecturally designed walls. Saigon Outcast shares an impressive display of curated graffiti pieces along its youthful avenues, and Duc Minh Gallery showcases an esteemed private collection of preserved art artifacts in an elegant fashion. Your exploration of the creative arts will be elevated in the evening as you transfer to the Saigon Opera House for the pinnacle of contemporary live performances. Set among the backdrop of the 120-year-old French colonial hall, expertly choreographed performances of cultural grandeur will take place and provide jaw-dropping entertainment for you and your partner.

dayInfo.title: Phu Quoc – Aromatherapy on an Idyllic Island
dayInfo.description: Today, you will escape the hustle of Vietnam’s landlocked destinations to a tropical paradise that knows no bounds. The island of Phu Quoc is situated off the Southern coastline of Vietnam, and you will charter here on board a private speedboat to capture the surreal sights in seclusion. The journey will leave nothing to be desired as you make a brisk getaway across the ultramarine waters of the Gulf of Thailand toward the white sand shores that encompass the entire length of Phu Quoc. Your voyage will culminate at a supreme beachside resort, where you will spend your quiet evenings being blanketed by the natural environment that will surround your splendid villa. The peaceful melodies of chirping birds, the rustle of leaves in the gentle wind, and the calm crashing of waves against the shores will make you feel worlds away from the roaring mainland. A team of exceptional masseuses await your arrival and will invigorate your minds and bodies amidst an undisturbed backdrop of unspoiled scenery. They will knead each knot from your back using a collection of aromatic oils, allowing you and your partner to unwind in tasteful style before you settle in at the resort’s luxurious restaurant for an evening of gourmet Vietnamese cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Phu Quoc – From Lush Jungle to Crystal Clear Sea
dayInfo.description: Phu Quoc’s wondrous wilderness that yearns to be explored, and you will begin your day by dipping your heads in the refreshing flow of Suoi Da Ngon’s gushing waterfalls. You will meet your knowledgeable tour guide after breakfast and transfer to Duong Dong Lake, where you will embark across its lengths on board a traditional barge. The expansive lake, which also serves to generate hydro-electric power, is nestled at the foot of a luscious hill-flanked valley, and the journey across it to Suoi Da Ngon will share stunning vistas of the untamed wildlife. You will hear little noise other than the environments natural ensemble as you delight in your intimate moments that are in sync with nature and finally make it to the sprawling emerald forest that surrounds the rushing falls. Your thorough adventures across Mother Nature’s endearing habitats will lead you to the crystal-clear waters of Phu Quoc’s hideaway beaches. You may set up camp for the day on the pearly white, soft-sand beaches under the shade of their palm tree-lined coasts and enjoy long romantic walks along the rarely visited pristine seashores.

dayInfo.title: Phu Quoc – Amidst the Splendid Sea Life
dayInfo.description: The An Thoi Archipelago, which is a UNESCO Marine Park that consists of 15 islands, lies off the southern coast of Phu Quoc and makes for a world-class day trip from your cozy resort. A private charter that is bound for the archipelago’s precious tropics will collect you in the morning and speed across the waterscape to concealed destinations along the immense stretch of islands. An Thoi will reveal its scenic splendor throughout, showcasing the colossal span of azure waters and brilliant beaches, which will welcome you to the untouched terrain. You and your partner, equipped with high-quality snorkeling gear, will dive into the depths of the sea to witness the staggering coral reefs that hug the island’s coastlines. Brightly-colored fish will swim around you before they retreat to their illuminated coral homes while magnificent octopuses will scamper across the seafloor. There is a wealth of fascinating sea life to see as you wade in the transparent water. You can make your way to shore for a delightful BBQ lunch that is fringed by the sloping sandstone mountains and lose yourselves within this slice of heaven as you wallow in your exquisite meal.

dayInfo.title: Da Lat – The City of Flowers
dayInfo.description: 5-star treatment awaits you within the picturesque landscape of Da Lat, which is a destination that is off the beaten path and is sought-after for its tranquil lake settings, vivid floral gardens, and European-influenced architecture. It is a whimsical location of tremendous countryside beauty that you will call home for a few nights. You can spend the first afternoon at your leisure or spoil yourselves with the impeccable vistas of the verdant vegetation as you tour across the blooming landscape and embrace the fresh, cool breeze. Your tour will converge at the Da Lat Flower Gardens, which is the beating heart of this capital that is often referred to as the City of Flowers. This is where bright rainbow hues cover the vast flourishing fields. Here, you can stroll through the fairytale garden, which releases a bouquet of delicate aromas into the air, and you will capture dreamy moments together alongside the elaborate plant life displays. You will continue your magical meander to the steps of Truc Lam Pagoda, which you will access via the comfort of a cable car across the stunning ravine. You will be provided with the opportunity to look out in all directions, where you can see monks as they carry on with their daily rituals within this intricately decorated and sacred site. It will be a sight to behold, and its serene atmosphere will fill you with a deep adoration for the humble spiritual traditions.

dayInfo.title: Da Lat – Safely Over the Falls
dayInfo.description: Adventurous couples will rejoice as the eighth day of your tour provides many riveting thrills just outside the city center on a canyoning experience that is unlike any other. Your escapade will begin atop a sloping cliff that is decorated with dense foliage, and you will descend into a surging ravine before trekking through the rugged terrain to a rocky ledge, which will be the base of your cliff jump into the depths of the brook. After a comfortable land, you can totally relax as you float along the flowing river while you impress yourself with your brave exploits. You and your partner will be ecstatic to have endured this demanding but fruitful expedition and will return to your room with amazing stories of your fun-filled afternoon. To culminate your adventurous day, you will share a sumptuous Vietnamese meal at a prestigious restaurant in Da Lat.

dayInfo.title: Cam Ranh – Blissful Rays of Beaming Sunshine
dayInfo.description: Your final destination will be an impressive resort in the Cam Ranh Peninsula that offers 5-star luxury within a secluded sandy setting by the beach. The region is less-frequented than its neighboring Nha Trang hotspot, and therefore, makes the perfect romantic getaway from the crowds. Excellent service and first-rate amenities will ensure that your stay satisfies your opulent tastes, providing unmatched intimacy within a tropical paradise. Your picture-perfect suite will look out over a private beach that you will have uninterrupted access to throughout your stay. Grab your things and head to the soft sand for a blissful afternoon under the beaming rays of sunshine that glisten off of the crystal ocean. Your professional bar staff will serve elegant cocktails to your seaside table as you indulge yourselves in absolute relaxation before you settle in at the resort’s esteemed restaurant and tuck into exclusive gastronomic delights. You can use the rest of the evening to connect with one another and cherish the moments of utmost affinity for the finer details of your adventure.

dayInfo.title: Cam Ranh – A Morning to Revitalize the Body
dayInfo.description: Your final day will be spent at your own pace. The sunshine will glimmer through your blindfolds and awaken the sleeping birds that let off a chorus of rhythmic chirps. You may hop out of bed and into the pool for a morning under the sun’s embrace or venture straight for the delicious breakfast spread of succulent, international, and Vietnamese cuisine. You will then indulge in the plethora of revitalizing spa treatments at the exemplified wellness center, where you will be completely spoiled for choice. Here, all of your stresses wash away with your gentle and therapeutic oil massage before you ready your things and wait for your private transfer. You and your partner, after having experienced many enchanting moments, you will depart Vietnam totally jubilant with your intimate vacation together.

tourName: Romantic Getaway to the Alps of Northern Vietnam
placesVisited: Hanoi, Duong Lam, Sapa, Ha Giang, Dong Van, Cao Bang, Ha Long Bay
generalInfo: A regal sea cruise across the emerald waters of Ha Long Bay, immersion amid the surreal scenic splendor of Sapa’s unspoiled environment, and voyages across the rugged mountain ranges of Ha Giang are only a few of the romantic escapes that you can expect to experience on this 14-day tour across Northern Vietnam. We have tailor-made this experience to take you to beloved destinations that are home to a wealth of insight into ancient Vietnamese traditions and its delightfully delicate cuisine. Bring your loved one on an endearing adventure through Northern Vietnam to create magical moments that will last a lifetime.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – A Charming Welcome to Northern Vietnam
dayInfo.description: The capital of Vietnam, Hanoi, is a culturally rich destination that exudes old-world charm from its abundance of enchanting experiences. You will rejoice in the heart of Northern Vietnam as you approach its diverse landscape and vibrant cityscape. You will meet your private transfer at the airport and journey to a luxurious hotel that overlooks the Red River and West Lake. You and your partner will ease into the local lifestyle from the comforts of your private suite that will be fitted with top-tier amenities. You will then spend your first afternoon around the relaxing pool and broaden your palate with world-class Vietnamese cuisine that will be prepared by the hotel’s prestigious restaurant chef. The sun will gently rise above your room the following morning and glimmer off the calm lake below, and the streets will begin to bustle with life as locals and foreigners alike venture for breakfast. You two will transfer to a delightful cafe for a sumptuous breakfast and a taste of Vietnam’s renowned coffee culture. Here, you can sit back in the stylish cafe and sip on local, aromatic brews as you watch the world pass. Afterward, you will delve deeper into Vietnamese culture at Hanoi’s Old Quarter, where you and your partner will cherish the quaint town and its many appealing and photo-worthy sights. Along the edges of the streets stand ancient buildings that showcase traditional Vietnam’s traditional architecture. As you peacefully breeze through the lively location, you will stumble across authentic delicacies at homely markets, catch tantalizing wafts of mouth-watering meals, and witness marvelous pieces of art in celebrated galleries. For sunset and supper, you will transfer to the gorgeous, green gardens that surround Hoan Kiem Lake. Here, you can walk along the winding pathways around the lake and capture magnificent moments together among the scenic serenity. Then, you will indulge in visits to significant heritage sites that encompass the lake for insight into the country’s decorous history. Finally, you will delight in marvelous meals at an award-winning Vietnamese restaurant, where a revered chef will prepare a romantic, candlelit dinner for you. You will retreat from the roaring energy of Hanoi to Duong Lam the following morning. Duong Lam is an ancient Vietnamese village that captures the traditional, local lifestyle in all its simplistic authenticity. It is a rural destination that retains lifelong, cultural values, and you will explore this depth by bicycle. You and your loved one will cruise along secluded streets and down back alleyways for a complete immersion amid the tranquil village. You can rest at a celebrated, local restaurant where residents enjoy classic Vietnamese cuisine. Accompanied by your private tour guide, you will share stories with the locals and familiarize yourselves with their humble ways of life. Your inspiring excursion will lead back to Hanoi, where you will encounter Long Bien Bridge and its endearing vistas. Here, you may capture stunning images of the sprawling green fields and serene river from this age-old overpass. An exquisite lunch at a coveted restaurant will culminate your stay in Hanoi. Your next destination lies amidst the majestic mountains of Northern Vietnam and is imbued with surreal seclusion for an utterly romantic experience.

dayInfo.title: Sapa – Swept Away to the Tonkinese Alps
dayInfo.description: One of Northern Vietnam’s most enchanting destinations is Sapa, which is an attractive town among the immaculate stretches of forest-topped mountains that are known as the Tonkinese Alps. The town has grown into a thriving tourist destination because of its immensely unspoiled beauty. In the summer, golden rice terraces cascade towards rivers, and Karst Mountains flourish with emerald foliage. You will board a regal train in Hanoi that is bound for your boutique hotel among the surreal Sapa scenery. The lavish voyage will reveal the desolate allure of Northern Vietnam's countryside while you delight in opulent relaxation. You will arrive, and the hotel’s professional staff will show you to your chic and private suite. With exceptional amenities and a world-class spa, your stay will exceed your every expectation. Your first evening will be spent in complete relaxation and luxury as you transfer to an elegant restaurant for a marvelous meal that will be prepared by a renowned chef. You will indulge in extraordinary recreations of classic Vietnamese dishes that are set inside a traditionally-inspired establishment. The following day will highlight the flawless majesty of the mountainous region. After you have eaten a delectable breakfast, you will transfer with your private tour guide to pristine wilderness locations. You will venture to the tremendously attractive Love Waterfall, which is where streams of silver water flow over the lime green, moss-covered rocks. The beloved waterfall is shrouded in a mystical folklore that tells the tale of a forbidden love between a fairy and a local boy who would come to the pouring falls to play his flute. Afterward, you can breathe in the fresh jungle air from the Thac Bac Bridge, which is backdropped by the mighty Thac Bac Waterfall. These two bewitching destinations share romantic atmospheres that are unlike many others. At each stop, your guide will part ways with you and allow you the opportunity to soak up the scenic splendor together. You will be swept away by the magical moments that you share in these idyllic destinations. The next morning will bring with it a dreamlike sunrise over the mountain-flanked skyline. Today, you will venture to the more traditional parts of Sapa to discover what makes the cultural traditions of Vietnam tick. Accompanied by your knowledgeable tour guide, you will venture to a signature, local restaurant for an incredible taste of authentic Hmong -style cuisine, which is an endearing food culture that originates from the Southeast Asian Hmong people. You will delight in the enriching flavors of traditionally prepared Hmong pork confit and spring rolls to name a few. Then, you two and your experienced guide will trek to a local hill tribe. This hands-on experience will introduce you and your loved one to the ancient lifestyle practices of these peaceful people and immerse you into their unchanged environment. You will learn a great deal from these people and their truly authentic way of life.

dayInfo.title: Ha Giang – Intimate Immersion in this Dramatic Destination
dayInfo.description: A few hours from the Tonkinese Alps lies the remote province of Ha Giang and its popular district Dong Van. After a filling breakfast in Sapa, you will board a comfortable coach and meander along the winding roads that lead up toward this precious destination. Along the way, you and your partner will capture blissful journey to a region that is rarely visited by foreigners. Among the sloping mountains of Ha Giang sits a historic, upper-class hotel that you will have the pleasure to call home for the duration of your stay. From here, you and your loved one will cherish expeditions across the unbelievable stretch of luscious landscape. Your first afternoon will be designed for you to discover the simplicity of the traditional lifestyle. You will venture to beloved restaurants for outstanding delicacies such as Pho , which an authentic Vietnamese noodle soup, and dried buffalo meat, which a Northwest Vietnam specialty. The evening will share picturesque photo opportunities alongside the emerald hills that roll off into the distance. The following day, you will explore the vast green paradise that is the Ha Giang landscape. Today, you will set off in your professional tour guide’s comfortable vehicle in search of the region’s treasured sights. You will marvel at the sheer majesty of the Quan Ba Twin Mountains. Immaculately kept rice fields flank these two tall hills and the mighty Heaven’s Gate, which is situated 1500 meters above sea level, will share uninterrupted vistas of the grand topography. Your expedition will continue to the highlight of Ha Giang: Dong Van Karst Plateau Geopark. It is a UNESCO World Heritage site that is famous for its monumental, limestone mountains and terraced, emerald rice fields. Many of the park’s distinguished rock formations are steeped in mystery with unidentified carvings that highlight their distant roots. Your day of exploration will showcase the dramatic landscape in all its rugged glory. Your final full day in Ha Giang will share more of the surreal settings and unique cultural heritage. At daybreak, you will transfer to Dong Van Old Quarter and visit the Dong Van Sunday Market. It is a colorful event that brings together Southeast Asian cultural minorities who display their ancient traditions with the utmost pride. You can peruse the vibrant market and encounter exuberant stalls that sell all sorts of timeless trinkets and food. The incredibly friendly atmosphere will ensure that you feel completely welcome among the cheerful, local inhabitants. You and your partner will delight in the opportunity to discover what makes these communities so special and how their ways of life differ from our own. You can explore more of Ha Giang’s humble environment as you visit significant heritage sites and witness splendid scenic sights.

dayInfo.title: Cao Bang – Magical Mysteries of Ancient Vietnam
dayInfo.description: You and your loved one will be whisked away to the peaceful countryside of Cao Bang, following your stay in the Dong Van district of Ha Giang. The marvelous destination boasts a wealth of captivating sights and holds significant historical value. You will soon appreciate these experiences in comprehensive detail as your adventure to Cao Bang will lead you to a boutique hotel that is run by a friendly, professional staff and offers exquisite private suites for secluded, intimate seclusion. You can spend the evening that you arrive at your own pace and tuck into delightful Vietnamese dishes as the sun slowly sets over the horizon. You may take advantage of this moment to connect with your partner and reminisce on your adventurous exploits. After a sumptuous breakfast the following morning, your travels will kick off in full swing. You will venture toward the famous Ban Gioc Waterfall and capture the awe-inspiring display of rapidly flowing water. On board a traditional boat, you will marvel at the powerful streams up close and feel the spring water breeze against your cheeks. Then, you will journey to an ancient cave and brave the golden tunnel systems that makeup Nguom Ngao. Stalagmites rise from the cave floor and create mystical rock formations that can be seen in the likes of popular travel magazines. You and your partner will traverse the depths of this cave system as your private tour guide shares the fascinating folklore in which it is shrouded. Finally, you will share in romantic splendor at the Valley of Secluded Love. Do not let the name mislead you, as it is an endearing title that has been given to the destination because of its divine allure that is represented in a classic Chinese novel. You can trot along the whimsical roads that lead to magnificent mountain displays and outstretching emerald valleys. You will thoroughly enjoy the environment as indigenous wildlife moves around you and presents idyllic photo opportunities. The following day in Cao Bang will highlight the treasured history of the location. Accompanied by your experienced guide, you will venture to sacred sites of significant importance. Starting with the Na Lu Ancient Citadel, you will witness relics of the Qin Dynasty and learn more about its prominence as an age-old military station. Your journey will continue to noteworthy temples and memorials that are sprawled across this Northern Vietnam region. You will uncover intricately designed statues and buildings that provide a lens into days past. This tour will perfectly capture the historical highlights of Northern Vietnam and will give you two an opportunity to share in the joys of first witnessing these sites.

dayInfo.title: Ha Long Bay �– Across Emerald Waters and Limestone Islands
dayInfo.description: The final destination on your romantic retreat across Northern Vietnam is the picturesque emerald waters of Ha Long Bay. This UNESCO World Heritage Site is a treasure location that is complete with towering limestone islands and immense stretches of peaceful sea. You will journey to the bay via luxury train and spend a night in an opulent resort that shares idyllic vistas. You will spend your first evening at a celebrated, gourmet restaurant and fine dine on exquisite Vietnamese dishes. You can watch the remarkable sunset over the bay as it illuminates the limestone cliffs and the shimmer of the sea. First thing the following morning, you will travel to the pier and board a luxurious cruise liner that is bound for the bay. The fluent and friendly staff will welcome you on board and usher you to your private suite. You will witness the immaculate sights from the comfort of your balcony and share in complete intimacy on board the regal boat. Throughout your stay, you will be treated to world-class cuisine at the prestigious restaurant in between your pristine adventures. The liner will gently glide across the water past the striking sights of limestone islands and hideaway caves. You will deboard the boat into a kayak as you and your beloved traverse the peaceful water and capture the magnificent sights up close. Then, you may take a dip in the warm water and swim among the towering cliffs that surround you. The voyage will move to a traditional floating village, where you will have the unique opportunity to connect with the locals who have set up houses on stilts in the water. You can also acquaint yourselves with this intriguing way of life and peruse the stalls in search of precious keepsakes to remember your enchanting expedition. Finally, you will reach a picturesque cave and cherish the moments that you spend within the age-old rock formation. A delectable dinner spread of various cuisines will conclude your day, and you will indulge in a candlelit dinner under the twinkling stars. Today, you will begin your morning with an invigorating Tai Chi session on the open-air deck as you feel the day’s embrace awaken your spirit. You and your partner will revitalize your minds and bodies as you perform timeless poses under the guidance of an expert Tai Chi specialist. Before you dock at the pier, you can fuel up on a marvelous spread of Vietnamese breakfast delicacies. Afterward, you will make your way back to Hanoi with ample time to catch your plane that is destined for home. You and your loved one will leave Northern Vietnam having explored all of its romantic highlights and will return home with unforgettable memories of this intimate adventure.

placesVisited: Hanoi, Sapa, Nha Trang
generalInfo: Experience the romance of undulating mountains and pristine beaches on this custom tailored tour through Vietnam. From luxurious resorts on private islands to emerald terraced hillsides that stretch across the landscape, from the colorful textiles of local villagers to magnificent tiger fish floating above the coral reef, you will find the culture of the northern mountains and the opulence of immaculate beaches. Explore the historic depths of ancient neighborhoods and enjoy a moonlit stroll through the temperate island jungle. Let the comforts of a dreamy hideaway create a lifetime of memories with the one you love.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - Alluring Cities
dayInfo.description: Hanoi is exotic and relatable, traditional and cosmopolitan. You arrive at the airport and are met by your private transfer who escorts you to your luxurious hotel in the center of the city. The charm of Hanoi is apparent in the streets. The skyline is dispersed and elegant. Vibrant trees wrap around the serene and romantic Hoan Kiem Lake. The French Quarter contains wide boulevards lined with greenery. The air is scented with ginger and chili that blends with the aroma of fresh baguettes. The day is at your leisure to stroll through the historic streets that date back a millennium or enjoy the strong and flavorful Vietnamese coffee at KOTO, a lovely café that offers underprivileged children the chance to learn the restaurant trade. In the evening you will enjoy a delightful candle-lit dinner inside an elegant French Colonial building before viewing the Water Puppet Show. The art form dates back to the 11th century and began in the flooded fields of rural Vietnam. Now it is one of the most popular traditional shows in the entire country. The colors are euphoric and the puppeteers are masterful. You watch them tell the ancient stories that have persisted through generations, expressed through theater and marveled at by locals and visitors alike.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - The Romance of Leisure
dayInfo.description: You wake up to the scent of freshly brewed Vietnamese coffee and warm, baked brioche. The French Colonial architecture continues to mark the modern culture of Vietnam and has blended into the traditions of Hanoi. After breakfast the day is yours to explore the city at your leisure. You can always enjoy a romantic visit to Hoan Kiam Lake. The water is tranquil and reflects the lushness of the overhanging trees. There is a mesmerizing ardor of Huc Bridge. Its entire body is painted a rich red. The wooden bridge arches over the water and connects the shore to Jade Island where you can find the Temple of Jade Mountain. The temple was constructed in the 18th century and honors a 13th century military leader. When you look over the side of the bridge you can see tiny ripples in the water. Endangered giant soft-shell turtles swim in the lake and seeing one is very auspicious. In the evening you can enjoy the ambience and flavors of the Green Tangerine restaurant. The quaint bistro décor combines the crisp tastes of Vietnam and the ambiance of the treasured alleyways of Paris. The king prawns cooked with mango offer a sweet and succulent cuisine to the night.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi - The Culture of the Red River Delta
dayInfo.description: After breakfast your guide meets you at your hotel ready to escort you into the countryside. Arrive in Duong Lam Village. The homes stretch along the Red River and date back almost 400 years. The traditional homes were built with mud and soil that is rich in iron. The water is tranquil and glassy. The villagers are gregarious. Large water buffalo pull carts through the main road which is paved with gravel. In the fields you see women wearing conical hats to protect themselves from the tropical sun. The fields make the countryside look as if it were paved with emeralds. Tall grass stretches into the distance. The village and its surroundings remain a stronghold in the wet rice farming culture. There is more than charisma in the people and their daily work; there is a connection to the little everyday details of enjoying life. In the afternoon you return to Hanoi and climb into a luxurious overnight train car that will take you north to Sapa.

dayInfo.title: Sapa - The Remarkable North
dayInfo.description: In the morning you arrive in Lao Cai and are met by your private transfer. Soon you come to Sapa, a city found near the border of China. The high altitude gives you an opportunity to look out over the surrounding valleys and see the sensational morning mist that seems to be floating just below the hilltops. You can see Fan Si Pan, Vietnam’s highest peak, which reaches over 10,300 feet above sea level. After breakfast the early hour mist has disappeared and you follow your guide down into the stunning valley to visit the H’mong ethnic minority villages. The H’mong account for almost 52 percent of the community in and around Sapa. The valley is rich and deep. The foothills are tiered with paddy fields. The lavish greenery shimmers in and around the village. The H’mong villagers are shy at first but the longer you stay the more open they become. The children’s smiles almost glow. The women wear sharp black blouses that have tremendously embroidered geometric designs embroidered on the sleeves. You watch some of the older women weave the clothing as they sit on their porch beneath an overhanging roof. The people are jovial in the midst of their workday as they weave and farm, eat and launder.

dayInfo.title: Hoang Lien National Park - The Rural Difference
dayInfo.description: The morning sun reaches down into the valley and spreads over the vast undulating grasslands. After breakfast you say goodbye to your village hosts and continue your exploration of the northern countryside. You traverse the hills and valley and come to more terraced hills which give texture to the panorama. When you arrive at the Red Dao village of Giang Ta Chai you are eager to visit the people and understand the difference in the variety of ethnic tribes around Vietnam. The village is built on the mountain slopes and stretches down to the flatland. The houses are rectangular and built with bamboo and wood. Their culture and traditions date back almost 2,000 years. The women wear bright colors and embelish their shirts with decorations made from silver. The men and women often cover their heads with red scarves. In the evening you will come to Topas Eco Lodge located on a hilltop deep in Hoang Lien National Park. The hotel offers premium luxury in optimum seclusion. When you settle into your comfortable accommodation you can look out over the wide valley and see the paddy fields along the mountains.

dayInfo.title: Hoang Lien National Park - A Day with the Landscape
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to enjoy the offerings of the Topas Eco Lodge and the surrounding luscious countryside. Whether mountain biking or trekking through the remarkable landscape our visiting one of the famous cultural markets in the town, the day will be filled with beauty and charm. On Sundays the Bac Ha Market brings people of the surrounding ethnic tribes to town as vendors. Black H’mong, Red Dao, and even Flower H’mong arrive early. The streets are filled with emotional warmth and traditional costumes. The market is at its peak earlier in the day when the colorful goods of many tribes are not only on display but for sale, from impeccably embroidered shirts to vibrant umbrellas. Women walk through the market with large baskets strapped to their backs to hold their goods, whether the ones they sell or those that they have bought throughout the day. You notice some people selling chilies that are a shade of red you have never seen before. You will eventually leave the bustle of the market behind. In the evening you will step onto your overnight train and make the return journey to Hanoi.

dayInfo.title: Ninh Van Bay - The Beauty of Exclusivity
dayInfo.description: You return to Hanoi in the early day. After breakfast you have the remainder of the morning to enjoy the subtle bustle of Hanoi and its familiar charm. In the afternoon you will make your flight to Nha Trang and be taken by private speedboat to the Evason Hideaway, one of Vietnam’s most exclusive hotels and scenic getaways. The boat speeds you along the pristine waters of the South China Sea. You watch the long stretch of Nha Trang’s coastline shrink into the distance. You come to Ninh Van Bay and notice the glossy sheen of the white sand beach that is bordered by lush tropical trees. Step onto the jetty and be greeted by the friendly and helpful staff. Soon you will be situated in your comfortable and luxurious room that overlooks the bay’s sapphire water. When the sun begins to set over the horizon the scent of fresh grilled seafood lingers in the air. The orange and red sky fades into night and the quiet sounds of the private beach soothe you.

dayInfo.title: Ninh Van Bay - The Wonders of the Bay
dayInfo.description: The days in your own private paradise are to be enjoyed at your leisure. Whether you prefer to spend your time sitting in the warm, pristine sand listening to the gentle crash of the water or venturing onto the South China Sea for a romantic cruise, you can do as much or as little as you’d like on and around the peninsula’s secluded shores. You can always enjoy a Saturday morning trek to the private beach of Bai Nho. The morning begins with fresh pastries that fill the air with a buttery sweetness. You follow your guide through the vivacious trees. The leaves dangle and sway in the early breeze. The sky is as bright and blue as the sea. In the distance you see endangered black-shanked langur monkeys. Their faces are a grayish-blue, surrounded by white whiskers. They sit on the open branches with their tails dangling down like a string. You reach the beach and look out over the gorgeous panorama. The water sparkles beneath the sun and refreshingly cool. The sand is warm and embracing. You can lounge on the beach and enjoy the solitude.

dayInfo.title: Ninh Van Bay - The Indulgence of Decisions
dayInfo.description: Wake up to the gentle sounds of the water lapping at the shore. You can see the morning hues stretching over the sea. The day is yours to indulge in the beauty of your surroundings. Whether you prefer to lounge in the warm sand on the edges of the cool sea or venture out onto the water of a marine expedition, you can be sure that the day will be stunning. A scuba diving tour will take you out into the major coral center of the East Vietnam Sea. The water is filled with over 389 varieties of soft and hard coral. When you splash into the water you find the sunlight shining beneath the surface and illuminating the aquatic life. At the Coral Gardens dive site you can find the rainbow colors of the coral shimmering in the crystal water. The coral looks like an expansive garden encompassing the undulating rocky sea floor. Lionfish swim near the calcite formations. Their fins wave in the current like a lion’s mane in the breeze. Their striped coloration is vibrant and intimidating. When you return to shore the aroma of poached lobster and zesty limejuice brings the gorgeous day to a romantic and fulfilling end.

dayInfo.title: Ninh Van Bay - The Island Life
dayInfo.description: You wake up to the soothing sounds of beach life outside of your room. The water ripples in the sunlight. Fishing boats are anchored in the distance. You can enjoy a secluded breakfast on your balcony as you watch the sun rise just a little bit higher throughout the morning. After your meal you can enjoy a variety of choices for activities. Among these options is following a hiking trail that leads to the top of Hon Heo Mountain. You can hear the trees rustle around you as you reach the summit. The panorama is all encompassing. You can see the crystal clear water and the resort’s roofing just under the edges of the tree line. Sporadic clouds drift lazily through the sky. The branches rustle once again and you notice the monkeys running through the canopy. The sweet air and the prolific trees give you plenty of romance in the unfettered ambience of nature.

dayInfo.title: Ninh Van Bay - Luxurious Touch
dayInfo.description: The day begins whenever you choose. You can hear the birds chirping in the trees. Fishing boats come and go in the distant water. You delight in a leisurely breakfast before you leave the comforts of your room. You can look out on both the shoreline and the canopy from different windows. Today you can even enjoy a couple’s massage at the Six Senses Spa. The scent of eucalyptus and incense help infuse a relaxed aroma through the air. You can feel the soothing touch of the masseuse unwind your muscles. The gentle sounds of the jungle add to the ambiance. Afterwards you indulge in beachside yoga that will rejuvenate your body and soul. As the sun lingers in the afternoon sky you reach and stretch your body to help counteract the far off stress of real life.

dayInfo.title: Ninh Van Bay - The Surrounding Islands
dayInfo.description: The magnificence of the sea goes beyond the shoreline and the wondrous world along the seafloor. Today you can enjoy an excursion to the surrounding islands on a speedboat tour around Nha Trang Bay. From white powder beaches to enormous palm trees that reach over the pristine water, you can explore the natural beauty of the surrounding islands. Beyond the islands is the interesting culture of the floating village. Local fishermen have constructed houseboats that drift and wade in the bay. You notice buoys and nets beneath the homes. The nets are filled with fish and lobster, raised by the fishermen for sale and use. The tradition of the floating homes in Vietnam dates back millennia. When you return to the shore you can sit back, relax, and watch the water brush against the sand as you sip a cool drink in the hot sun.

dayInfo.title: Ninh Van Bay - The Coupling Effect
dayInfo.description: Today is your final full day in the relaxing and secluded setting of your private getaway. With the day at your beckon call you can enjoy another excursion out onto the water or sit in the pool and watch the sky drift by. For a romantic and treasured experience you can partake in a five-star cooking class that will allow you to recreate the flavors you tasted throughout your time in Vietnam. The light and fresh herbs and vegetables bring crisp flavor and herbaceous aromas to the kitchen. Follow the demonstrations of your private chef as you are guided through each step of preparation, from ingredients to dicing, cooking to tasting. By the end of the course you will be able to dip your homemade prawn hand rolls into the fresh peanut sauce you’ve just created and taste the succulent flavors of your romantic vacation.

dayInfo.title: Ninh Van Bay - Returning from the Hideaway
dayInfo.description: Today you will have the morning at your leisure. Enjoy the view from your room once last time as you sip your fresh brewed Vietnamese coffee. You listen to the water’s ebb and flow. You hear the monkey’s rustling the branches. You watch the sunlight spread over the surface of the sea. Your private transfer will return you to the main land where you will soon arrive at the airport for your flight home. You have ventured to secluded mountaintops and private islands and now you will take all these unforgettable memories home with you.

tourName: The Ultimate Vietnam Tour: An In Depth Cultural Journey
placesVisited: Hanoi, Ha Long Bay, Sapa, Hue, Hoi An, Nha Trang, Ho Chi Minh City, Mekong Delta, Can Tho
generalInfo: There is always more to a painting than what is seen on the surface. This custom tailored tour will whisk you into the depths of the brushstrokes that make up Vietnam’s culture, traditions, and landscapes. From the brilliantly colored clothes of the northern hill tribes to the sparkling emerald waters of Ha Long Bay, you will experience the traditions of grand cities and the elegance of the remarkable countryside, the vivacity of the gregarious people, and the layered flavors of the traditional cuisine. Whether found along the sandy shores or at a floating market, you will discover the fine details that define Vietnam.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – Into the Depths
dayInfo.description: Arrive in Hanoi, the capital city of Vietnam. The modern skyline brushes against the traditions bringing a combination of evolution and culture and creating a palpable energy to the atmosphere along the streets. You are met at the airport by a private transfer and taken to your accommodation allowing you the remainder of the day to rest and wander at your leisure. Nestled beneath the high-rises are plush and tranquil lakes, such as Hoan Kiem Lake, shaded by dangling branches and filled with legend, serenity, and a beautiful temple. In the evening you will delight in the flavors of a local restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – Onto the Streets
dayInfo.description: After a delightful breakfast which offers you a choice of western or Southeast Asian dishes, or perhaps a combination of the two, your guide arrives ready to orientate you to Hanoi. With over 1,000 years of history blossoming within the neighborhoods it’s hard to know where to start. Your guide brings you to the most notable landmark of the city, the imposing stone structure of Ho Chi Minh’s Mausoleum. The almost temple-like architecture is fixed with strong masonry and rigid angles overlooking Ba Dinh Square. Later you will come to One Pillar Pagoda. The beautiful temple rises from the center of a square lotus pond, ascending on a single pillar and resembling a blossoming lotus flower. Constructed in the 11th century, it has become one of Vietnam’s iconic temples and is accessible by a graceful stone staircase rising to the terrace.

dayInfo.title: Ha Long Bay – Sitting on the Top of the Bay
dayInfo.description: Today you will leave the elegant combination of culture and modernity behind, venturing to the stunning scenery of Ha Long Bay, another iconic image of the country that you have only seen previously through photographs. With thousands of islands along the archipelago sculpted by the elements and time, you look into the emerald waters that make up the Gulf of Tonkin without reservation. Cruising through the charm of rising limestone karsts with the mist in your face will eventually bring you to Sung Sot Cave, also known as Surprise Cave. The colors of the rock walls change with the reflected light bringing bright green and even purple hues draping across the deep grotto. The ceiling hovers around 90 feet tall and leads to various halls. One such hall features stalactites that dangle in a variety of shapes and look as though they melted from the stone; there is nothing but natural majesty to captivate you. In the evening the boat will anchor along a quiet cove where the sound of the tide brushing against the rocks will lull you to rest.

dayInfo.title: Overnight Train – Boats, Cars, and Trains
dayInfo.description: The morning washes the night away bringing hues of pink and red to the sky. The aroma of a light breakfast of fresh pastries mixes with the scent of fresh brewed coffee and the sweet smells of the sea. The grandeur of the strong rocks draped in brush and rising over the water’s surface is never less than stunning. In the late morning you will dock along the bay and return to Hanoi. The remainder of the day is yours to enjoy the city at your leisure once more, whether by revisiting the Temple of Literature or enjoying the herbaceous aromas that linger within the Old Quarter. In the evening you will have a private transfer to the train station to board a luxury car that will ferry you into the far reaches of the north along the Chinese border.

dayInfo.title: Sapa – An Open Market
dayInfo.description: The train pulls into the station early in the morning and gives you a unique view of Vietnam away from the cityscape of the capital and a different type of discovery. The Ethnic Market around Lao Cai is known for its collection of villagers that come from all over the mountainside to sell, barter or buy. The scent of effervescent produce mixes with earthy aromas. The colorful textiles that the women wear and vend are diverse, unique, and elegant, fitting with their particular cultures which are often unseen by outsiders. Flower Hmong people almost glow with the pinks, greens, yellows, and blues of their wardrobes, including the intricate shawls wrapped around their shoulders and the angled headscarves worn over their hair. Roots and brushes are displayed in the expansive and jovial market beside woven bags and paintings. After lunch you will come to Sapa, a sleepy hillside town that stands just above the morning mist creating a distinctive picturesque quality along the mountainside. The altitude often brings a chillier evening to the city, but offers a perfect excuse to indulge in the sweet and comforting flavors of a hot chocolate.

dayInfo.title: Sapa – A Time for Exploration
dayInfo.description: The mountains surrounding Sapa can only be described as breathtaking, unique in their image as well as in the cultures of the people who reside there. After breakfast you will follow your guide into the majestic landscape trekking along the sloping mountains into the valley below. H’mong villages speckle the mountainside and create sensational terraced rice paddy fields that rise up the landscape texturing the scenery. Water buffalo graze along the seemingly endless greenery. Your guide brings you to a variety of villages where the children are both excited and anxious as you traipse through their open yard. However, both children and adults alike are thrilled to see new faces and welcome you into their village. The homes are built by compressing earth and raw material into formidable building blocks. When you make it to the nearest road you will be met by a jeep and taken to Ban Ho Village, home to a Tay tribe. They welcome you into their home with grace and curiosity. Their village is positioned at the foot of a mountain and is filled with ambience of friendliness. The women wear skirts and blouses often embroidered with intricate geometric shapes. In the quiet evening of the mountains you can rest within the hospitality of Ban Ho Village.

dayInfo.title: Overnight Train – Upon the Night Train
dayInfo.description: In the early calls of the rural morning the scent of the fresh cool air surrounds you. You enjoy the early hours along the hillside where you can watch the light inch closer over the terraces bringing a sensual glow to the day. At breakfast you are once again met by the graciousness of your hosts; a particular bond has developed between you during your time spent in their village. Soon you say goodbye to the village and to the villagers as you make your way back to Sapa. The city hasn’t changed during your time away but it feels different, a bit cooler, and possibly a bit larger. Another sip of hot chocolate helps the perspective return. Upon your transfer to Lao Cai you will once again board the night train that will have you back in Hanoi by morning.

dayInfo.title: Hanoi – Time to Indulge
dayInfo.description: The train pulls into the station in the morning around the time the city begins to come alive for the day. Your private transfer will take you to your hotel where you can spend the day relaxing within the comforts of your lodging or venturing back into the diverse splendor of Hanoi. The scent of ginger and chili seem to waft along the streets tickling your taste buds. If you prefer to spend the day sampling the city’s eclectic and generous cuisine than you can always try a private dining experience located a short distance outside the center of town inside a chef’s own home. The complex Vietnamese flavors are combined with modern techniques, a union that has rewarded the restaurant, chef, and diners with the unique results.

dayInfo.title: Hue – Modern Capital to Imperial Capital
dayInfo.description: The morning brings the effervescent scent of fresh Vietnamese coffee alongside your breakfast. The early hours of the day are yours to indulge in Hanoi once more before you are whisked to the airport and find yourself within the charming and once grandiose Imperial City of Hue. Your guide meets you at the airport, and soon you are drifting along the tranquil surface of Perfume River on a dragon boat. The boat is adorned with two brilliant serpents with maniacal smiles that are radiant against their blue scales. The concentric hexagonal layers of the Thien Mu Pagoda create one of the oldest religious buildings in Vietnam dating back to the early 17th century. Rising atop the hill on the north bank of the river, the seven tiers each represent a different step on the path to enlightenment. A short boat journey brings you to the magnificent tomb of Emperor Minh Mang. Modeled after Chinese architectural concepts, the emperor’s tomb sits within a six-square-mile complex constructed in the 19th century. The beauty of the complex is not just in its architectural marvels but also in its tranquility. Walk along the cobblestone paths, over the footbridge that feels almost level with the pond, and then climb the stairs of the double terrace to the entrance of Minh Mang’s tomb. The opulent attention to detail in the entirety of the complex brings awe along with beauty.

dayInfo.title: Hue – Into the Ancients
dayInfo.description: The grandeur of the previous day sits with you in the morning light as you wonder how today could possibly compare to your previous days. Once more you will enjoy a delightful breakfast before your guide meets you and leads you across the bridge to the remarkable ruins of the citadel. What was once the former imperial seat of the government is now filled with a vast collection of historical temples, pavilions, walls, and gates. The main southern gate was constructed in the 19th century by Emperor Minh Mang. The central door and bridge were exclusive to the emperor. The Forbidden Purple City sits at the center of the complex behind the Thai Hoa palace which was almost completely destroyed during the Tet Offensive of 1968. The history of the citadel dates back hundreds of years and also to contemporary times bringing a deeper connection to what was left behind.

dayInfo.title: Hoi An – Over the Splendid Pass
dayInfo.description: Today you will depart from Hue leaving the brilliance of the Imperial City behind you. As you make your way over the Hai Van pass you can’t help but notice the beauty of the landscape; the rolling mountains sweep down to the coastline blending the turquoise hills into the sapphire water. At times it looks like you ascend above the clouds and you notice the mountain peaks in the distance standing over the mist before it dissipates. Arrive in Danang to visit the Cham Museum. The indigenous Cham have roots that date back to the second century while the museum boasts a collection of terracotta and stone artwork that dates back to the seventh century. The building itself is a blend of French and Champa architecture surrounded by budding flowers, dangling leaves, and simple turrets; known symbols of the Hindu religion. The museum is famous not just for its grand collection of Champa era artwork, but also for being the only museum specifically dedicated to Cham history. Its halls are filled with images of Ganesh and Shiva, tigers, and Vishnu. After a relaxing visit to China Beach you will find the charm of Hoi An comforting in the evening.

dayInfo.title: Hoi An – Riverside Delight
dayInfo.description: The floating-lantern charm of Hoi An is combined with its classic history as a city that rose out of an illustrious trade route in the 15th century. Images and reminders of this historical period remain, from the Japanese Bridge to the Tan Ky house. Outside of the city shines a deep historical and cultural attachment known as My Son Sanctuary. The Hindu temple dates back to ancient Champa and can be viewed within the ruins that stand surrounded by impressively green jungle and tall mountaintops. Similar to the sandstone ruins of Banteay Srei in Cambodia, walking through the collection of temples is both peaceful and somewhat energizing within the reach of such vast history. The intricate carvings on the temples’ sides range from images of gods to myth all woven into history on the surface of the stone. The deep red shimmer of the stone stands out against the growing foliage and makes you feel as though you have discovered this ancient world.

dayInfo.title: Nha Trang – Rivers Lead to Oceans
dayInfo.description: The gentle drip of the river marks the serene morning within the classic Old Town streets of Hoi An. You enjoy your breakfast before venturing onward, away from the charming lanterns and unique architecture, to the stunning sand of Nha Trang situated next to the lush jungle. The Riviera of the South China Sea brings you a stretch of white shoreline and sapphire water; a panorama of mountain ranges rises behind you and numerous islands lie before you. Relax in the alluring calm of the soft, warm sand. Dig your toes into the cool, crystal water. Your days sitting beneath and umbrella tasting the fresh seafood have begun.

dayInfo.title: Nha Trang – Beached Leisure
dayInfo.description: There is no more soothing sound than that of the water lapping at a powdery sandy shore. Whether you sleep through the sunrise or prefer to watch the deep pink and purple hues of the sky spread to the distant islands and rising hills, it will happen one way or another. The day is at your whim and pleasure, giving you the opportunity to spend it resting in the sand with your fingers sliding into the softness, or golfing along the palm tree studded course if you so desire. For a spectacular view of the coastline you could enjoy a snorkeling tour that takes you just off of the reef. The coral is as iridescent as the fish, some of which are striped at angles and others glow neon yellow. Turtles glide through the water, coursing through the still and glassy current beneath the surface. The world within the sea is as stunning and interesting as the world above it. The cool saltwater is refreshing while the sun warms your skin giving you a perfect balance, a magnificent ambiance, and a fabulous first full day along the shore.

dayInfo.title: Nha Trang – Independent Beaching
dayInfo.description: Today brings another chance to enjoy the surrounding beauty of the beaches and jungle offering you the best of leisure and activity, whichever you prefer—possibly even a mixture of the two. After breakfast the sun begins to hover over the sand. For a spectacular visit to the surrounding culture you could visit Long Son Pagoda where an image of Buddha reaching over 72 feet tall is surrounded by images of monks celebrated for their stance against corruption. A long, arching dragon glides and guides the path along the steps to Buddha. If you follow the path behind the statue you will come to a panorama Nha Trang reaching across the city to the sea.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City – South China Sea to Capital City of the South
dayInfo.description: The fresh scent of the sea will soon drift into the distance as you are taken from Nha Trang to the airport to catch your flight to Ho Chi Minh City, the largest city in the south. This former capital of South Vietnam could be called the most modern city in the country. The skyline reaches higher and farther than one you have seen thus far. However, the essential ambiance of the country, that of culture and flavor, is alive and well in the depths of the city center, around the Saigon River, and extending outward beyond the reach of the skyscrapers’ shadows. The city dates back to the reign of the Khmer and has been evolving ever since. The sensual aromas of ginger and garlic dance through the eclectic streets. In the evening you can enjoy the delicate flavors of Vietnamese cuisine, allowing you to try new flavors or relive dishes you tasted along the rest of your journey, from tomato and crabmeat soup to spicy beef noodle.

dayInfo.title: Ho Chi Minh City – Former Saigon
dayInfo.description: The scent of breakfast reminds you of the luxurious sands of yesterday as you enjoy the flavors and aromas that have brought you to what was once Saigon. After your meal your guide will once again meet you within the lobby of your hotel ready to show you the wonder of the city. The streets showcase what once gave the title of “Pearl of the Orient” to Ho Chi Minh City. Within the remarkable history you find a bright red light shimmering off of the stone of the Notre Dame Catholic Church.
